message:
What else can you expect from this bank, that is why we just left. We have FREE CHECKING with no minimum balance, plus we can call our representatives and not be charged. BB&T showed their true colors Feb 23rd 2018, this bank has
non caring Branch workers, Non caring Representatives,  most of all they are  LIARS. They never to this day told the truth whst really happened, they had their own BB&T employees coming on Facebook belittling people who were going through the crisis  that week.  I screen snapped every last word of it. They seriously suck...I advise you to stay far away from these thieves. Seriously. 
 I tell everyone I know this too.
 All they care about is making money off of you.  They never did anything for their customers either after what we went through.  I hope this bank fails...KARMA

I'm getting the 'run around' and NO help!! have found papers for a CD maturing 2009 from Colonial Bank, after a week local branch mgr Adam Yablon (sarcastic) said he did research cannot find anything so 'good luck". I asked to escalate, where to I go, who do I call, give me a direction, he said call corporate in NC customer service. I called they said its local branch responsibility, call Adam. Recalled Adam he gave me Natalie Evertt phone, asst to Mark Wroblewski (his direct boss he said). LM 2x no return call. ***SO WHO DO I CALL FOR HELP IN FINDING THIS CD? I think it is still good but I need paperwork showing the money was given to me. Is this a federal bank regulation issue to report? I feel this bank is being very unprofessional and unhelpful.

Cannot enroll on online business banking! I keep getting the following error when trying to create an online account: "A third-party server is not responding. Possible causes: the server is down, there is a hung application on the server, or network problems. This is not a problem with the WebSEAL server. " How is it possible that such a large bank has so faulty a system?
I love my BB&T<U+2764><U+FE0F>. Thanks for  sharing.
Thank you for this information!! Saved it!!

Are your phone systems down???? Like why can I NOT call the number on the back of my card and check on my debit card information??? Y’all are THIS close <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B1><U+008C><ed><U+00A0><U+00BC><ed><U+00BF><U+00BD> to making me change banks and I been with y’all for 5 years!!!!!! Need an answer ASAP or I’ll be OMW to the nearest BBT branch to snatch my lute and deposit it elsewhere.

WORST BB&T in existence!  They are ridiculous!  They denied my customers, locked my accounts and told me to come in on a Saturday knowing good and darn well the department that releases the locks isn't even open on Saturdays.  I had to close my store for 2 1/2 hours to sit at a branch on a Saturday for nothing!  The stupid teller that called and verified the check friday night was so rude and obviously should not be working in a bank.  I have written checks and had no issues at all with cashing them.  They called me and verified the transaction twice and still refused to cash the check for the customer.  Very poor service.
Worst bank ever, glad we left in Feb! Why their BB&T ads still comes down my news feed really irritates me. I seriously want nothing to do with this bank.
Let's teach them to not unplug the banking servers.
Hi.  Can someone please PM me?
I have been having issues with the banking app. A quarter of the time it doesn’t work to find out how much I have in the bank!
Dad, you’re awesome!

BB&T is the worst bank to do business with.  They are crooked and sneaky like a snake in the grass!  They lock your accounts for suspected fraud for no reason at all.  They dont call you, notify you, email you, or anything.  They are pathetic.  I do not recommend anyone doing business with them!
Praise God .. To God Be The Glory

BB&T needs to offer Ripple services. It only takes 4 seconds for money to be placed into your bank account anywhere in the world with Ripple. RBC has it and they are having big success with it.  5 days too long to wait for transfers. Ripple
Great Job Kelly !
Thank you BB&T for your support of this wonderful organization!!! Proud you have been my bank for over twenty years!
Why am I getting neighbor spoofing phone calls from your organization?
BB&T you suck, glad we left you in Feb!
Love love love this story!!!
Great bank! Terrific story!
Awesome piece Manny Ohonme
Proud of you, Manny Ohonme and Samaritan’s Feet. <U+2764><U+FE0F>
Manny, your courage inspires!
Amir Biglari

It’s funny how a transaction that I didn’t make suddenly is my problem and then when I call and express my frustration i get told “well did you spend the money?” This is the second time I’ve had issues with BB&T it’s embarrassing to wake up in the morning to a negative balance that wasn’t your fault. And I can’t get a credit because it’s something that I did that I DIDN’T do! I will be leaving BB&T

I thought everything was supposedly fixed!!! My account was still messed up today and I was going to call to see if they could get rid of the crap there that posted that wasn’t supposed to be there. I ran out of time but just looked at my account now and I have a bunch of pending transactions added that had previously posted. I only had 2 pending transactions earlier today.

Funny. I get text messages with every transaction I make. I balance my checkbook everyday and I account for all pending transactions, but somehow according to customer service everything is correct. IT IS NOT. I will be changing banks today

I'd like to know how do you "make things right" for my wife who had a serious dental appointment this past Friday and had to reschedule this appointment for yesterday because of a deposit we relied on last Thursday night.  I watched my wife suffer through the weekend because of this... Don't believe me, call Aspen Dental. Tell me, how do you seriously "make things right" for someone who after a fall had to have a serious oral surgery and really need to see the dentist again just three days later (last Friday). Admit it, you can't and won't "make things right" for something like this.

We have a total of 7 accounts between business and personal. Was it a stressful few days....yes, especially on the business end. The professionalism of the call center staff and their genuine, honest assistance was A+. BB&T staff are also account holders and they were going thru this just like we were. I remember days of getting to the bank on Friday to get cash for the weekend. We are spoiled by phone apps, ATM banking and having everything at our fingertips. Good reminder to keep some cash on hand! Thank you for helping us as best you can thru a situation that you did not anticipate and hated worse than I did I’m sure!
And I like how they keep saying please email us so that we can assist you! Like they are actually going to respond! PLEASE!

My account access and updated transactions were available quickly. I appreciate the bank’s communications and willingness to work with customers. Oh, and I’m not an employee, just a customer of 12 years.
Ummmmm Saturday through Monday? I sure you hope you mean UNTIL it's fixed. My account is still in the negative and it's Tuesday!

Can someone PLEASE for the love of God give me the phone number to call to make a payment on a loan account? The online system will not accept a payment as large as what I'm trying to make and said I have to call to make it over the phone. I have wasted over 30 minutes calling every 1-800 number on the website I can find and can't get through to anyone that can help me. The automated system said to contact my local branch, which I did, and they said they couldn't help me and transferred me back to the automated system. I have never in my life had such trouble trying to give anyone money. Based on this laughable level of customer service I would NEVER bank with BB&T after this loan term ends and I would NEVER recommend BB&T to anyone else.
Still waiting on the money from the overdraft in my checking seeing as I dont have overdraft and waiting for the money to back into my savings. Hoe much longer?

I have emailed with NO response. What sucks is that I do not even bank here. My payroll company does and it's costed me hundreds of dollars in fees because I had scheduled payments come out of the account that I'm suppose to receive my direct deposit in. Now I'm getting late fees on top of that. This is ridiculous.

I’m getting incredibly frustrated.

Just a few months ago we paid an overdraft charge on an account that doesn’t even have overdraft, but decided to take the hit and pay it ourselves instead of raising a stink. This happened way before this whole fiasco started. 

Now there is money moving in and out of our account constantly and it’s impossible to manage it. The balance seen when we check the app or website isn’t our genuine balance and we’re being charged for transactions that happened last week and that we assumed had already been withdrawn from our account. Just paid them $100 or so in money overdrawn while our balance was inaccurate and not up to date, after talking to an employee at our local branch and now our account says it’s overdrawn again by $15. SO gets a paycheck tomorrow and I’m honestly scared it’s all going to disappear. 

I’m disappointed in BB&T and feel like I can’t trust them with our money anymore. Really considering changing banks because we can’t afford to have money disappear and have a transaction list not even the BB&T employee at our local branch could make heads or tails of. 

How are we supposed to know how much money we have when the balance isn’t up to date and transactions are being delayed by literal days? This is incredibly stressful and something I can’t afford.

I'm in the negative now because of the "lapse in service", and BB&T sent back my direct deposits- telling them the account was closed.. Well, it wasn't closed, and it's not.. but it will be by tomorrow.

What I want to know is how they kept track of what I spent after my tax refund was deposited but yet don't have anywhere showing where the deposit was made. I have overdraft protection so if the funds weren't in the bank I wouldn't have been able to spend what I could. Now I'm negative hundreds of dollars?? Something isn't right but they will be hearing from me again first thing in the morning if my account isn't fixed and my tax refund isn't deposited! The irs says it was deposited the 22nd I'm getting beyond pissed at this point.

I just got off the phone with there very unhelpful care line. BECAUSE it's saying I've got an negative balance of 658.00 WTH I ask the said there trying to rectify the problem and see where I was double charged and processing fees plus over draft fees. I've been with BB&T for dam near 4 year now with derict deposit every month for my disability widows pay. That's this Friday and I have never had one bounced check the whole time much less over draft fee totaling a whopping 658.00 dollars Exspeaily when all I receive to live off of, is 847 a month. Lord help me. I'm closing my account for good tomorrow. Because I guaranty that I want get my money back, I went through that almost 20 years ago at state employees bank where they let this fraudulent companies hit my account and take every single time in it, over 1600 dollars just disappears and their was anyway to make them replace it. Said I must have giving out my acct number would be the only way for them to do it. Trust me I didn't, but I couldn't prove prove it. So this happened during Christmas hollydays, so I could pay rent bye Christmas for my 2 kids or pay power bill or food. For a single mom I had a real had time with it because I had wrote checks on money that someone stole out of my account. So I had 827.00 0f overdraft fee, count cost plus the amounts of each checks. So that was a whole I never wanted to end up in. And once again a bank has screwed me over. Lord Lord . I wish I would have known this was going to happen again. Its a good thing my kids are grown up this time around.

I have a question about your ATM at the Milton Pennsylvania 17847 branch it is out of service quite a bit and I have to use another in the area that is not your bank affiliated and I have to pay a fee quite often can't you see about putting a different one in I know it is a new one but it is out of service more than in.

I had a couple of duplicate transactions that came and went (usually with one completed and one pending). No impact. I was one of the fortunate ones in that the problem hit the day after a scheduled direct deposit cleared.

Yesterday I woke up with -93$ and today I wake up to -237$ <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+00AD><ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+00AD><ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+00A9><ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+00A9> whyyyyyy!?!?!? this has been so stressful !!! my debit card shouldn’t have worked if there wasn’t enough money in there !!! <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+0095><U+2639><U+FE0F>
This is interesting, because I had 2 Fees pop up over the weekend... they disappeared... and this morning came back again.
Ben doing business with this Bank long before it was BB&T  I've never had any trouble . ( since 1963 to 2018 )
App isn't working AGAIN today. I'm closing my accounts next week...

Okay...it is now thursday and my deposit from last friday still isnt posted! My teller was on phone with corporate and was told yesterday they were still finding ACH files not uploaded so thats why my deposit from ADP hasnt went thru. Will it be tomorrow bbt or am i gonna go another weekend broke due to this fiasco??

I have been very patient since Saturday but now I am losing my patience. My daughter sent me $108 and some change through Cash app. Something that she does on a weekly basis. I have never had a problem with her deposits until Saturday. I’ve been calling the bank since Saturday and the rep told me that the money was denied that my daughter needs to call her bank to see if it actually came out. She checked her bank account online and she also called. The money was withdrawn and they also said they don’t see anywhere where it’s being credited. I just hung up from a manager at BB&T and was told that 4 representatives gave me the wrong information when they told me on 4 different occasions that my money would be deposited.  I called every day since Sunday and each time I called I was told that the money would be deposited the next day.  Where is my money BB&T??? The transaction was approved on my daughter’s end and on my end!!!!!<ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+00A1><ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+00A1><ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+00A1><ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+00A1><ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+00A1><ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+00A1>If it wasn’t for this BB&T’s mishap I would have my money. Why are they trying to put the blame on my daughters bank?  I even told my daughter to send me a pic of the withdrawal from her accounts.  Her bank said there is nothing for them to do on their end. I am beyond pissed at this moment.  I was also negative in my account for days!  This has been a huge inconvenience!! I want to charge BB&T $34 for insufficiency to my account every day starting on Friday!!
I still have some duplicate charges.. should I check on it or wait to see if bank resolves accounts.. almost afraid to pay bills..
Guess we gotta get the news involved again to get results
You STILL have not acknowledged my deposit from Thursday Feb 22 of $499.75. Even with the transaction id provided! I cant live on your promises. I need my money!
Anyone having trouble with online banking today.  I can't login any accounts.
My accounts are back to normal....appreciate your efforts.  Been with you since 2004.
How about paying me for the work I missed because you rejected a payment for my software???
Where are my tax returns that were supposed to be deposited on the 22 still have no information at all

This is my first bank account an I’m almost 30 years old an this is the reason why smh my account is negative 1200$ an I chose to opt out of over draft because of this reason... so if it wasn’t in my account why allow me to use my card<ed><U+00A0><U+00BE><ed><U+00B4><U+00B7><ed><U+00A0><U+00BC><ed><U+00BF><U+00BD><U+200D><U+2640><U+FE0F> one day it’s 1700 the next day it’s 97$ I’m so frustrated an overwhelmed at this point <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+009E> I’ll prob bank with someone else after this is resolved this is unacceptable in so many ways

All of this sounds shady BB&T. My fiancé banks with you guys and I luckily don’t and I’ll make sure he moves banks as well. He had fraudulent charges made (emails were sent from Walmart.com saying 5 TVs were being shipped to some rando in Miami) this happened at 2am Friday morning, I suppose as your systems went to hell. Duplicate charges are on his account, similar to other customers that have complained and “nothing can be done because the charges are still pending”. Why is this “system malfunction” (lol you’re not fooling anyone who works in technology with that) not in the news? Why are comments getting deleted? This is people’s MONEY you’re dealing with. I hope a class action ensues. Good luck loaning out money when you lose all of your customers.

Thank you for your diligence and effort to fix the issue. Sorry you had to deal with unfriendly, non understanding people. I've banked with you all for 7 years and have had no complaints. Thank you again <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+0081><ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+0081><ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+0081><ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+0081>

BB&T I am so upset about this. I withdrew money from my account at the bank on Saturday because I couldn’t access my money. I was told I had 500 left in that account. I then purchased dinner and some gas and woke up to being in the negative and had double charges. I also had several overdraft fees applied. I have called twice to get this all resolved and was on hold over an hour to speak to someone only to be told that they would have a supervisor would call me to get all of this corrected today at 12 PM. Guess what? No one called me. My account is still negative and no one seems to be able to fix it. I wish I had withdrawn the remaining amount from my account that day as well but no, I trusted the bank would get back on track. Never thinking the bank would take every dime I had in this account and leave me negative over 1,000.00. I think we all deserve more than an “I’m sorry”.

Are there other cases of people with deposits that were once available but are currently missing that still haven't been resolved as of Tuesday morning? I've spoken to 4 people now who continue to tell me to wait. This is the most frustrating banking situation I've ever encountered.

Has anyone actually received a refund for anything other than atm fees and overdraft fees? I had money reappear in my account and assumed it was my refund because they were generic atm transactions, come to find out it was just a magically disappearing and reappearing transaction and now I am overdrafted.

I am beyond angry...for 2 days now I have held on the phone...visited a branch. I am being told that BB&T can not fix the problem and yes it was caused by the failure of the mainframe. I have spoken with several people at BB&T and none of them say they can help me...Maybe my next call needs to be the Attorney General...I am not getting any help from what I thought was my bank :( :( :(

Wells Fargo will PAY you $100 if you open an account between now and March 17th.  Super nice and helpful.  I opened checking and savings accounts with NO FEE options. Just waiting for a couple more transactions to clear before I close my last account with BB&T

I spent a hour on the phone yesterday trying to figure out what was going on with my account.  BBT ended up waiving the 72$ in overdraft fees only to leave me with a -175.00 which should NOT have been in the negative.  So I go to the bank and make a 180.00 cash deposit which put my account in the positive.  I thought everything was all over,  until I get home and my account is -8.00$$!!! WTF! I called BBT and they said that it was a debit transaction from 2/22! It put me back in the NEGATIVE and the customer service was horrible....basically there was nothing she could do about the debit transaction being delayed to post!!!!!!  This is insane! Also, on a side note my direct deposit didn't go through today like it was supposed too and the bank says they don't even see it pending. :( :( :( :(

Today we are being debited yet again for TEN purchases that have already posted! PLEASE do something about this ASAP! I understand things happen and equipment malfunctions, but it has quickly passed the point of being an "inconvenience" and has instead become a cause for serious concern. It has been almost a week now.

It’s weird that I got an overdraft fee (109$) when my account wasn’t ever in negative. I lost money some how. I had 46$ in my account last night when I went to bed. Woke up to -128$ went in and talk to the bank an they told me the 109$ overdraft would be out back into my account but wouldn’t say anything about where my 46$ went too. I had to transfer funds so I wouldn’t be charged tomorrow for it being negative.

Can Someone Please Tell The CEO/Board of Directors, Thank You. I was in a branch for something else and asked the bank manager what happened. She was very upfront about the problem. I really loved that the whole thing was handled with honesty. I also was very impressed with the level of customer service across the board considering what a mess it was to deal with. I used to be with Wells Fargo for many years. When they had their"incident", they were horrible. No one was informed and no one would tell the customers anything.

I don’t know how this isn’t news. I thought things were straight today. Husband still has a deposit missing in our joint account. Tonight, we both have a multitude of duplicated debits. I come on here and see lots of others saying the same. It’s been 5 days now. No equipment failure should result in this kind of debacle. I was planning to make a cash deposit tomorrow but may just go close the account instead. I’m seriously fed up.

My account is STILL messed up. A deposit from my work was taken away last night during processing. Multiple items that were declined are now posted to my account. Instead of crediting my account for duplicate transaction reversals you took more money!!! This has gone on long enough.

Logged into my mortgage today expecting to see a $0 balance and it had a $45k balance.  It's ok though BBT because you had an outage.  How you guys still find customers is mind boggling.  Google BB&T reviews and you'd be hard pressed to find one single good thing said about your trash bank.

We called to try to find out why our account is negative when we keep up with it all on paper to just be told nothing is wrong with the account but we are still missing money just to be told "no you arent". We will be pulling all the money out tomorrow and going to another bank. This is ridiculous.

I’ve had this same bank account since 1997 through Susquehanna and I’m not happy. It’s been a nightmare ever since they merged, this was the last mess up for us, we are closing our account and looking elsewhere.

Lmao I call BS!!! I am most certainly missing money from my account, no idea where it’s going! I called BBT yesterday and chose the option to have them call me back instead of being on hold...NEVER got a call back. Am currently on hold now, and have been for 50 minutes. I’d like to know what the hell yall are going to do to remedy this situation!

Thought I was in the clear.  Account was fine this morning.  Now it's showing a transaction pending for the 3rd time.  It cleared on the 23rd, was pending last night with the accompanying reversal credit, was gone this morning and is pending again tonight, but no reversing credit. BB&T you really need to get your act together!  Enough is enough!
I'd like to not be randomly negative with an overdraft fee right now after the hell you've put me through to even see my accurate balance. You need to fix the problem now.
Mistakes happen.  While the impact of this is unfortunate I appreciate the transparency and earnestness of BB&T coming out and talking to your customers directly and apologizing.  apology accepted.

Went it to pay what negative balance I had, not knowing anything about this because noone decided to tell mecalled just now  and another ten dollars negative. I'm so mad! Give me back my money! This isn't right. Why must we suffer for a screw up that was made on bbt part. Not fair to us. And it's very convenient that this happened AFTER the first batch of tax refunds hit the accounts! I got things to pay and a child to feed. I'm already struggling in life, why make it any harder. I sincerely hope this error is fixed immediately!!!

My account is still in the negative due to a duplicate transaction of $466.00.
Called the local branch and I get the run around and told "We'll look into it"

I don't know if it's the entire company, but the local office is a joke when it comes to fixing issues. 
I'm definitely done with this bank.

I've had the same problem on numerous occasions, to the point where I stopped even bothering to contact customer service because they've got me convinced that I'm crazy and never offer to do anything about it anyways. I prefer to use cash as much as possible at this point because that's easier than dealing with BB&T and will be switching banks soon. I've banked with BB&T for years and never had so many issues with overdrafting until recently. This always happens over weekends where deposits never seem to post but all other fees are so quick to be added and purchases to be subtracted. I keep track of my spending and note of pending transactions as well in order to ensure I do not overdraft. I thought I was the only one having a problem with things saying they've posted, then changing back to pending later. Then somehow when Monday comes around I hit negative and am immediately charged with outrageous overdraft fees on top of everything I spent. I don't know if I'm being charged more than once or what but I know the amounts that I'm spending and the math never seems to add up. I also ALWAYS have issues with them holding money people have Venmoed to me but when it's the other way around, it always comes out of my account immediately. It honestly makes no sense. I've called and gone to my bank in person to see if anything can be done but just like you, I'm always told that everything on my statement is correct and nothing can be done about it except for me to fork over even more money to only have a balance of $0 <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B9><U+0084> I can never get anyone to understand what I'm saying and get talked to like an idiot and explained the definition of overdraft because they don't believe me. My card is set up NOT to overdraft, if anything it should decline. Even if i do seem to get them to understand, the overdraft fee is never waived when these "mistakes" are made. Will this issue be resolving itself? Because I'm getting really tired of my money just disappearing into thin air and owing money due to your "lapse" in service.

My taxes have gone missing. The IRS said it's my bank. The bank said its the IRS. None of my questions are being answered and I'm now missing a lot of money and spent my entire day playing phone tag and have gotten nowhere. I'm now in touch with my attorney and an investigation team regarding this matter.

I am very upset with BB&T! 
My account was fine! And you guys charged me a return statement fee making me go $1 in the negative! Then charged me for an overdraft fee! And didn't alert me that your bank was robbing me until 4:27am (clearly not enough time to fix it)! I had the money in my savings account I could have transferred to cover the $5 that I should have never been charged! I swear y'all just create your own fees and ways to scam your customers out of money! I am transferring banks when you open! <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+00A1>
You over draft my account while I was sleeping! Wtf?!

I am tired of hearing that BB&T is sorry for the inconvenience statement. I already set up our direct deposit with another bank and once our account is straight here we will close it.  I want to make sure I get back all overdraft and return fees first. I have been a client for 20+ years and can’t wait to get away from this awful bank. I have been spreading the word and also looking to see what else can be done. We had a large direct deposit last week and couldn’t even enjoy some of it over the weekend. Good luck to those of you who stay. I now will have free checking that will actually gain interest

I just got an email from BB&T telling with the following: Our records indicate you set up a transfer to process on Thursday, Feb. 22 or Friday, Feb. 23, 2018. Unfortunately, we have experienced a system issue that duplicated your transfer. Will you please review your transaction history within account details to determine if you need to make additional transfers to reach the desired account balances?

So, BB&T... you're telling me it's my responsibility, the customer, to review my accounts and correct your mistake?  Seriously?
Mine was fixed yesterday but today it's back to not working. It's difficult to keep up with my account when I can't check my balance.

Also,, obviously, BB&T wasn't doing anything bad to the customer(Like W.F.) But your company did not have to tell the customers what happened either. Any how, "Thank You" your bank handled things well!<ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B9><U+0082>

Once again I have duplicate pending transactions showing in my account. Everything was fine this morning and now transactions that have already been processed two days ago are pending again. When will this nightmare end?!

So....... after all this, the problems created have been “fixed” by you guys, but no good faith offering has been made? The SEVERE inconvenience for thousands of people has no one concerned?? Frankly, I’m taken aback that this company has done NOTHING to make this people feel secure placing their hard earned money in your hands! How absolutely disrespectful!

So, within 48 hrs the fees should be gone? I almost had a panic attack when I looked at my account just now! Also, I had previously seen duplicate transaction adjustments on my account and those are gone now too. Because an email or text wasn't sent when this first occurred, I didn't even realize anything was going on until Saturday when I took a closer look at my account. Now, it's so messed up, I just feel filled with anxiety. :(

I am still waiting for a Supervisor to call me. On Feb. 28th a Supervisor credited an Overdraft Fee and a duplicate charge. The next day it "magically" disappeared. On March 1st a different Supervisor said I had a "provisional" credit and should have not spent any money. I told her it was not explained to me that it was temporary or provisional. She refused to fix my account. I asked to speak with someone above her and she said someone will call me in 24-48 hrs. I have also sent messages on my account. Oh,and by the way, I have incurred another Overdraft Fee. I only hope someone in power will get in touch with me and remedy this.

So why not a couple of years ago when we were frozen in in Sweetwater, TN and surrounding Monroe County? I pleaded with the branch manager and she said no because I already had "one" I was like, um, it was declared a disaster and roads were blocked and travel banned. Her reply? Well I made it here....

I am getting hundreds and hundreds of $$ in fees.  One time I look and there is $2000, next day I have $-107.  It has been since Feb 22/23 and yet I am still on hold for 50 mins at a time. Ridiculous!

Warning::::: DO NOT BANK HERE. I JUST OPENED MY ACCT LESS THAN A WEEK AGO AND CAN ALREADY SAY THIS IS ABSOLUTELY IN BOLD THE WORST BANK EVER!!!!!!! When opening a checking and savings account, I was prompted to deposit $50 into each account with my debit card from my other bank in order to make a deposit. So I used my debit card and deposited $50 into each account-checking and savings. They only put $50 into the checking account and as a result when using my card I went into -$26. I called them at 11 PM to tell them that I could not figure out how to add funds with my debit card to correct the balance and bring it out of the negative and was trying to do so by midnight so I would not receive over withdraw fees. The initial employee I spoke with said I could only add funds at the branch which at that point was closed. They also told me the cut off time for charges was 9pm, not midnight which I have never even heard of before. I explained my concern that I was never informed that using a debit card to add funds was only an option when making an initial deposit and not available in the future. He agreed and stated that it was a “good question,” but said he could not solve my problem and help me fix my balance to prevent any fees, so I asked to speak to a supervisor. Upon speaking to the supervisor -no exaggeration - he would not let me speak and continued to talk over me. When I expressed my feelings in regards to not being informed when signing up that I could not use my debit card in the future to add funds he responded “well it didn’t say you could either, did it?” I was so appalled that it took me a minute to gather my thoughts because I literally thought I was dreaming to be treated like this by not only any employee—but a supervisor. I haven’t even gotten to the worst part.... in response to his rude comment, I asked him if he would please allow me speak and stop speaking over me so I could try to prevent getting charged $216 yes that is correct ($36 per transaction up to 6 transactions a day from what he told me) even though I opted out of being able to over withdraw, and he HUNG UP ON ME!!!!!!!!!!! I am still in disbelief as I type this and I will do every single possible thing regardless if I have to spend every second of my day to make sure that this never happens to anyone else who signs up with this piece of you know what scam artist that they call a “business.” I will report them to the Better Business Bureau, I will plaster it on Facebook, I will plaster it on Twitter, I will plastered on telephone poles if I have to because I am DISGUSTED and because they are simply deserving of it as well as the innocent VICTIMS that they refer to as customers. What BBT is failing to disclose is that the outage resulted in duplicate transactions for some customers (I have some on my statement). The only way to know this is to see an unusual credit for "DTrans" or simply "Duplicate Transaction" followed by a brief message in the message center. To date, BBT has not mentioned this publicly. This outage resulted in real consequences for customers which have yet to be acknowledged by the company. BBT is playing it like "our online service and ATMs went down, sorry for the inconvienience" when actually, their services went down, they duplicated certain account debits when they recovered, and they still have not fully recovered several days later. I understand the bank is willing to cover fees associated with the outage, but do you have any clue as to how much stress this is causing? How can I be sure my mortgage and car payments wont be duplicated this weekend? What does BBT plan to do to prevent this sort of thing from ever occurring again?

Warning::::: DO NOT BANK HERE. I JUST OPENED MY ACCT LESS THAN A WEEK AGO AND CAN ALREADY SAY THIS IS ABSOLUTELY IN BOLD THE WORST BANK EVER!!!!!!! When opening a checking and savings account, I was prompted to deposit $50 into each account with my debit card from my other bank in order to make a deposit. So I used my debit card and deposited $50 into each account-checking and savings. They only put $50 into the checking account and as a result when using my card I went into -$26. I called them at 11 PM to tell them that I could not figure out how to add funds with my debit card to correct the balance and bring it out of the negative and was trying to do so by midnight so I would not receive over withdraw fees. The initial employee I spoke with said I could only add funds at the branch which at that point was closed. They also told me the cut off time for charges was 9pm, not midnight which I have never even heard of before. I explained my concern that I was never informed that using a debit card to add funds was only an option when making an initial deposit and not available in the future. He agreed and stated that it was a “good question,” but said he could not solve my problem and help me fix my balance to prevent any fees, so I asked to speak to a supervisor. Upon speaking to the supervisor -no exaggeration - he would not let me speak and continued to talk over me. When I expressed my feelings in regards to not being informed when signing up that I could not use my debit card in the future to add funds he responded “well it didn’t say you could either, did it?” I was so appalled that it took me a minute to gather my thoughts because I literally thought I was dreaming to be treated like this by not only any employee—but a supervisor. I haven’t even gotten to the worst part.... in response to his rude comment, I asked him if he would please allow me speak and stop speaking over me so I could try to prevent getting charged $216 yes that is correct ($36 per transaction up to 6 transactions a day from what he told me) even though I opted out of being able to over withdraw, and he HUNG UP ON ME!!!!!!!!!!! I am still in disbelief as I type this and I will do every single possible thing regardless if I have to spend every second of my day to make sure that this never happens to anyone else who signs up with this piece of you know what scam artist that they call a “business.” I will report them to the Better Business Bureau, I will plaster it on Facebook, I will plaster it on Twitter, I will plastered on telephone poles if I have to because I am DISGUSTED and because they are simply deserving of it as well as the innocent VICTIMS that they refer to as customers. I hope to God that they record their conversations so that they have it when I take this further. I don’t care if it’s for a penny or a million dollars, NO ONE DESERVES TO BE TREATED LIKE I WAS TONIGHT AND I WILL MAKE SURE NO ONE ELSE EXPERIENCES WHAT I DID. BB&T You should be utterly ashamed of yourself.

Our online and mobile banking platforms, automated Phone24 service and ATMs are available. We are still working through a few issues for some of our clients and will be providing additional guidance through Secure Messages within our U online and mobile banking apps. We can also assist you at 800-BANK-BBT (800-226-5228). You can always find the latest information on our site at: https://www.bbt.com/sites/bbtcom/outage-information.page

Banking services are available and our associates are completely focused on serving you today. We’re extending hours today, Monday, February 26, and adding associates in our Care Centers, financial centers and social media response teams today, just as we did on Friday and over the weekend. If you have incurred bank fees directly related to this outage, we will waive or reimburse those fees.   

You can contact us here on Facebook or Twitter, call us at 800-BANK-BBT (800-226-5228) or stop by any of our more than 2,000 financial centers. We are deeply sorry this has happened, and we’re thankful for your continued patience. - AN

I do not understand the angry emojis. Technology breaks down on occasion and BB&T is willing to do what it takes to make it right by reimbursing fees and working hard to fix the issue. People need a reality check if they think everything should be perfect and flawless 100% of the time.

Big thanks to all the BB&T staff.
You all gave us security, and comfort on these few days of anxiety.
Your behavior with your clients demonstrate is worth it and secure to have a bank like yours in our side.
Let’s continue doing business together..
I’ve found BB&T Corporate as being rather cold and uncaring.  Wish my former National Penn Bank had not been bought out by BB&T.

Truthfulness says a lot about a company.  What caused the outage? I would assume a bank as big as BB&T has redundant WAN connections, application/file servers just in case of a failure... So... Security breach? <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B9><U+008A>

As an employee of a company that uses BB&T to process weekly payroll, this is very disturbing!  Sure, you told all of the BB&T customers to bring their check stubs to the bank to receive their money.  That’s great but what about those of us that have accounts elsewhere?  Here it is Monday morning and my check is now showing in my account.  This problem was much deeper than ATM’s and digital banking and I am not sure it has been fixed.

I can say that as a retired BB&T Insurance employee & customer, BB&T strives to give excellent customer service.  When there's a system's glitche they have staffing that work long hours to get the problems resolved. They do care about their clients. This was an inconvenience but nothing that can't be corrected. Mr. King, Thank you for your sincere personal message.
I am proud to be both a BB&T associate and client. This has been a trying past few days but it is refreshing that Kelly King made a comment.
It took him 4 days to make an announcement that told us nothing! You keep saying I'm sorry but that doesn't help anyone!

Highly disgusted with this bank since the day you took over my old bank. I will be this weekend switching banks and steering clear of any other company associated with you. I've been double charged, deposits never deposited and now this. I'm done. Someone stole my card number at the beginning of Feb and I had to wait almost 2 weeks to get my money back. Heard nothing but bad from many people in our area since you took over.

Seems awfully funny that every other BB&T post has accumulated hundreds of negative comments, yet this post has mostly positive “cheerleader” posts. A couple people have mentioned this, but really, do some of you think that this is acceptable??! “These things happen”, NO! That is no excuse! These things do not happen. Floods happen, fires happen; natural disasters “happen”, but a financial institution of this size can not possibly have one piece of equipment to handle all of these malfunctioning issues, can it??! And if so, then I’m jumping ship because any good business (second generation business owner) knows that you do not put all your eggs in one basket- you have back ups for your back ups! They are not new at banking! So maybe you are “understanding” that this corporation dropped the ball- good for you, but I for one- AM NOT UNDERSTANDING. Read all the posts, hear what these people are saying!!!! They aren’t whining! They are at a deficit! Through no fault of their own! Each and every one of us HAS BEEN WRONGED. This corporation has been entrusted to be responsible with all of these people’s money, and they screwed up by not doing the responsible thing (having a back up system), THEY FAILED. They need to FULLY ACKNOWLEDGE THIS and make some sincere and genuine apologies to their customers, as well as retribution. That’s business. You inconvenience your customers, you make it worth their while.

Have been a BB&T customer for many years. Have had home loans, car loans, and personal loans with them and have always offered great service. Not going anywhere. I like my bank. Everyone has problems at times and businesses are no different.

I was a satified customer of my old bank of 10yrs until BB&T took over. This is a terrible bank I left recently soo glad I did. Sorry for all you folks that have to endure this inexcusable inconvenience.

I met Kelly King outside of Ashworth Drugs in Downtown Cary a couple of weeks ago. He came by to see Ralph Ashworth and give his condolensces to him for his loss. I introduced myself and told him I had a small family business in Downtown Cary and that I was a client of the Kildaire Farm/Maynard Road branch. He asked about my business and if there were anything I needed that BB&T would help NC Soap Opera Company in anyway it could. He is really a very nice man.

BB&T, what exactly happened, what was the problem with the piece of equipment? Did a disgruntled employee damage it? Was is an accident? How did it become damaged? Could it have been damaged to mask something bigger than this? As in it was damaged to make everything go down so someone could do even more damage to BB&T and the accounts? We need answers. Why was there not back ups? Were the back ups damaged too, or just not up and running? Or did y'all decide to not run the back ups thinking it was something that could be fixed quickly? We all have heard the same story for 3 days now. Give us the FULL story! I know some people haven't been affected like others, and there are some people like myself that are still affected and can't even check their account! Before anyone says I need to keep cash, guess what I had cash. But I always withdraw more on Fridays for the weekend. Thankfully I had the amount of cash I did. But its Sunday night. The cash is running low, very low. Will you reimburse me for the cash I had to ask my family for since I cannot get into my account? I've been patient up until this point. Now my stress and anxiety is rising because we are not getting answers. How long will it be before everyone can access their accounts? Are you going to pay for my doctor's bill if I have an anxiety attack, or pay me for lost wages because I have no gas in my vehicle to drive the 144 miles I travel in one day, round trip, to work? Just food for thought BB&T.
Instead of accepting those Million Dollar bonuses Mr.CEO, how about you take that $ and upgrade that 1999 computer network BB&T runs on...just saying from a former employee...

We have been BB&T customers since I was 15 years old. We personally appreciate BB&T for making a sincere apology over an incident they had no control over. Yes, I was “inconvenienced” for a brief period but that is life. Again, we have always been appreciative of the respect that we receive from our BB&T bank and appreciate their transparency during this outage.

Just want to say the folks in Rte 501 Conway and Socastee branches did a wonderful job with many upset Customers I saw! While lines were out to the door in Socastee the crew was amazing! Very patient and professional! Actually funny to see the area bank managers looking busy working a very very rare Saturday! They sure looked out of place! Anyway kudos to these tellers! You should be proud of them!

Their systems are antiquated and it's time they upgrade their whole banking network! I worked on the same banking system they use over 10 years ago with National City before PNC bought them. Nothing is real time and in today's day and age this is unacceptable. Instead of wasting millions of dollars on BB&T/U app which sucks and Sales Force.....we need leaders who can make technology decisions that customers need!

BB&T is the absolute worst bank I’ve ever felt with my entire life. Since ive opened my account they have held one check 3 times when it shouldn’t have been held at all. It’s been charged 2 times for a one time card transaction. And I’ve had to take today off of work because my temporary didn’t work at a BB&T ATM. Real nice. I’ll be ending all business with this bank today.

Wow, this is rediculous..got a secure message through the app that says they are aware that they doubled my debit purchases/bill pay however, it will not be fixed till Tuesday..really? Two more days I have to wait for you to refund my money. Time to look for another bank..<ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+00A0>

@ BB&T. the payroll company my employer uses, uses BB&T as their bank.  I use a different bank and have not received my direct deposit, which I should of received Friday.  Just wondering when I may see my money?

MR. King ,it would be nice if you would st up closing down small town branches! You use our money that we trust you with, even though you past little or no interest on it . Then like all big banks you get greedy and after all the small banks close down because of a bigger bank we lose. Then more greed sets in and you pull up stakes and leave town . That's not good for customer service either.

My Cleveland Branch in Garner always greet me with a smile and  the staff gives me EXCELLENT service!  Jennifer Albright in the Smithfield office is an asset to BB&T as well as the staff at the Cleveland Branch. Awesome service from well trained staff!

Indeed BB&T has helped numerous times with their attention to detail. Just two days ago I was charged twice for two seperate purchases at a Walmart self service checkout. BB&T caught the mistake and corrected it, replacing my hard earned money back into my account. They are quick to notify me of charges that seem fishy such as out of state charges or uncommon purchases. Thank you BB&T......
Thank you BB&T. I appreciate a company that will come forward and say we have a problem but we are going to fix it and make everything right. Nice doing business with you.
Williamston SC is disappointed that our branch was closed didn’t even leave us a atm. We have been with BB&T for 40 Year’s always been happy with them but we need our bank.
This is why I love being part of this company!! Kelly King is a class act who truly cares about this clients and associates

They let all these people deposit money Friday knowing this. It had been a problem since Thursday. Some people had to go all weekend without money. They took out my debits but could not find my deposit. I am pretty much done with BBT. Our atm is down as much as up. We have 2 lines on Friday and cars wrapped around the building. Plain envelopes half the time at atm or none. BBT has really gone down here. I am pretty much done looking for another bank.

While I know it has been frustrating and stressful for everyone I will say that I appreciate that BB&T did everything they could to make it as stressless on myself and even made sure I got the cash I needed on Friday to get me through the weekend while they worked all the issues out and by Sunday my account was exactly as it should be with no extra fees or surprises!  Thanks for all the hard work!  I am staying with BB&T!
We have already heard this? You didn't inform us with anything new? You can apologize but it's not fixing the issues some of us are experiencing<ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+00AF>

Yea, this still doesn’t make up for anything you have done. I hate BB&T. Took my wife and Kid out to eat and pick somethings up. To only be told that my card has been denied. So I look up my account and I have over drawn and not been able to get the things I needed. I was fortunate enough to have a boss who put gas in my truck up so I could make it to work. I will be leaving BB&T just as soon as I get a chance to move to CHASE!

I’m at an audit of a government entity client who just changed banking services from BB&T to a local bank.  Moved over $3 M in assets out of BB&T because they refused to waive the $150/mo ($1,800/year) in account fees.  

Doesn’t sound like an organization that’s going to be around this area for long.

Thank you to our understanding, patient and loyal clients. I know I speak for a lot of associates when I say we truly understand how you feel and we are here to do whatever we can to help. A lot of us were affected by this as well, we understand.  Thank you for giving us the opportunity to make it right <U+2764><U+2764>
As a current BB&T client and BB&T retiree I appreciate the efforts this bank is putting forth to take care of clients.

BB&T truly is a great Bank!  I worked for BB&T for 9 years and can honestly say they’re one of the few companies I worked for that goes over and beyond the call of duty for their clients.  Thanks BB&T for everything you do to protect and inform us!

BB&T - Thank you very much. I've been a customer with BB&T since 2010 and I have never had a problem. When there was a problem it was rectified immediately. My accounts are fine and thank you for the update.

BB&T is there an ETA as to when the double transaction issue will be resolved? I have one on my account, there is no general deposit correcting the double charge, and I'm afraid to use my account at all. I may stay with you as a customer, I may not; I'm still deciding. This has been very disconcerting. And I've been a customer since KNBT got bought by National Penn, and then National Penn was bought too.

SO glad I closed my accounts with @BB&T; got out just in time, it seems! No local branches so spent HOURS on the phone because they mischarged fees; locked my accounts repeatedly; never received new debit cards or correspondence by mail or email; and the final nail in their greedy corporate coffin was when they put my accounts in dormancy. Again NO correspondence of any kind alerting me of their impending action; I was never made aware of such a policy, by post or electronically. Their bizarre explanation was, "A little longer  (in this dormant state) and ALL my money would've gone to the federal government"! Was that an effort toward an apology, that I should somehow be grateful to them?!

It's a terrible thing that so many have suffered so much anxiety by not having access to their accounts and money. I know firsthand how embarrassing and stressful it is when you swipe your card to pay for groceries, for example, the card is declined and you have to leave the store empty-handed with people staring. It's incredibly humiliating, but worse still is you have to tell your kids there's nothing for dinner!

Good riddance, @BB&T!

People are saying these things happen like they're used to it. I've banked with and worked for a few banks for several years. I've never encountered such a HUGE problem with any bank before! We have banked with BB&T for several years and this has never happened before. Not having access to our direct deposit for 24 hours, not even knowing how much it is, is a little unnerving. We trust banks to keep our money in check for us so we don't have to worry so much about it. Had I not got paid from a different account and us having a little cash on hand, this could've been a lot worse. I do have to paya late fee on one of our bills that was being paid out of our BB&T account though because they charge it after day one past the due date which was Friday. This to me, should not have happened. There should be back up systems in place. I was completely ready to move ALL of our accounts elsewhere and if we continue to have issues, we will.

We live in a modern age of technology. Equipment breaks or gets damaged. Anyone remember when halve the East coast was blacked out due to an ice storm. Stuff happens. The point is that BB&T is doing everything possible to correct the problem and take care of it's clients. It does however take time for them to correct every thing for the millions of their client.

I got my income taxes by Friday and everything has been good on my end with the exception of our local ATM down but other than that, I'm not freaking out about this. Things happen- technology isn't perfect but at least you guys are still trying and that's all we can do. Tomorrow I'm going to my local BB & T to take precautions needed and just wait this out. At least they're giving us updates and not completely keeping us in the dark.

Some people need to get a clue. It's a computer system, things go wrong. Look at all the different breaches, viruses and other crap that is out there that affects computers. Yes checks and stamps are an inconvenience for some, but maybe you should try going to the way some things used to be. Don't complain when the system is down, it's no fun trying to get work done without computers, because that's the only things some folks know how to do things on.

I am STILL Having issues. So I don't know what you mean by "fixed" and 'resolved". I am seeing duplicate credits and debits. At this freaken point I don't know what my true balance is. I need to pay a bill or my power will be shut off. So I will be paying it and if it bounced its on you. So tired of this bank and you bs.
Good, can you refund my $72 overdraft fee. Clearly you double charged me on SEVERAL transactions and now I was hit with a fee that should had never happened. #Pissed

I have had my account with BB & T since i was 16 years old.....even before it was BB & T.....this is the first time anything like this has ever happened....it has been a little unnerving, but I have appreciated all the updates.  I cant imagine banking anywhere else.   Stuff happens....guess it goes to show we should alway be prepared for the unexpected.

Apology NOT accepted! I have a total of 10 personal and business accounts with BB & T, but I will be moving them very shortly. I live in Manassas, VA and you have way too much competition for me to tolerate this. I have been told numerous times by management that the reason branches are closing and hours are shortened is because the money is being put into technology. The branches around me are in complete chaos!!! They're closing and shortening hours. So while there are three branches in Manassas VA, only one has Saturday hours, and even they act like they're doing us a favor. The branch nearest to me closes at 5 pm. All the while other banks are opening branches on every street corner, with normal bank closing hours of 7 pm. The last straw, Mr. King, was when I left work early (as I always have to in order to do my banking) to make a business deposit and cash two personal checks I wasn't able to complete my transactions. Ohhhhh rest assured you could take the deposit. But you couldn't cash my checks. So somehow you're willing to take money in, but can't give me MY money from a check that was drawn on BB & T as well. And the kicker is that it was from a mainframe computer crash. What happened to all the money put into technology? Are you seriously trying to tell me you don't have some type of backup system??? I run a small business with 6 employees and even I have a backup system. This would have been way more palatable had I been notified of this. I get emails from BB & T all the time wanting to loan me money. But not for something that truly impacts me and TONS of others. So you, sir, are a snake!!! A good, decent, honest person would have alerted your customers WHEN IT HAPPENED. Not after it goes viral on social media and in the news. How do you even lay your head on the pillow at night? HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE way to do business. Especially a bank. Money, and access to OUR money is a daily thing. See most of us aren't the 1% like you, Mr. King. I know your total pay between salary, bonuses, and stock dividends in 2016 was over $8M. Most of us will never earn that in a lifetime. So how could you possibly realize how this grave mistake affects the rest of us? Well, I am one of the many people who will show you - by moving my money. I was informed by one of your employees that BB & T is one of the top 10 banks in America. I asked her what criteria she was using and she couldn't answer. I can tell you hands down it sure as hell isn't customer service!

I worked for BB&T for 27 years until my job moved to Charlotte. We were blessed with a great Chairman and CEO. Mr. King not only cares about  BB&T clients, but he cares about all BB&T employee’s. I can tell every client that he and the staff of BB&T never take the client for granted. Clients will be heard and their business is truly appreciated. I was blessed in so many ways during my 27 years and I give God and our CEO credit for the blessings I received. If you are not a BB&T client, check them out. You will never regret doing so.

I understand that it causes headaches, stress, tension, inconvenience for a lot of people but instead of insulting the bank and offending people in the media, try to work with the bank first to correct the problem and I am sure that the bank will refund your fees and funds if the same is due to the outrage.  If you don't get the help that you need from the bank then, of course do what you have to do.  But please don't jump to conclusions.  No one is perfect and certainly our technology is not perfect so try to work with the bank first to solve the problems without insulting them.

We do not live in a perfect world. Things happen and computers malfunction. I called Friday and was helped by a friendly associate who answered my questions. Yes this was an inconvenience but I cannot imagine what it must have been like for the associates working there. I am sure BB&T was doing their very best to try to handle a difficult situation. We are so quick to criticize others when we are inconvenienced. What if we were to try a little kindness and instead of only thinking of ourselves thought of others as well. Yes this has been challenging for us as customers but it has been much harder for the employees who are having to deal with constant calls and I'm sure many rude customers. If we could just all work together to try to make a bad situation better we would be much better off.

I am a happy BB&T customer. My debit card worked all weekend and I withdrew money from the ATM on Saturday. Sorry for those that had problems, but please don’t be so critical. BB&T has one of the best fraud departments of any bank.  I’m sure they are doing everything in their power to get everything up and running. 
Please be considerate and patient. I’m not an employee just a satisfied customer for many years.
I used to bank with BB&T. We switched banks years ago. Pitiful CS.... to those that suffered because of this... time to switch banks.
We experienced no problems that I'm aware of. ATM was out of service but caused us no inconvenience. Still a loyal BB&T customer.

Great your committed to making it right, there’s another vague statement.  How are you going to make it right, are you pay me for my inconvenience? I highly doubt it, my money will be leaving your bank. A technical issue can be understandable but Bb&t is one of the biggest banks up the East Coast, where was the back up system there is no way it should have taken this long especially for a bank to come back online.  Bb&t makes enough money that they should have top notch equipment.  I was originally a National Penn customer until you both merged, it is sad that my perfectly good bank that I always banked with was bought out by Bb&t. Since the merger the fees have went up and the quality of customer service has plummeted.  Plus I never had an offline/ outage issue with National Penn and with Bb&t it seems quite normal that there’s system issues, normally it’s for a short period of time but this time the amount of time with an outage is was more than unacceptable. I wouldn’t be surprised if you don’t lose 30% or more of your customers. Also how do I explain to my son that I couldn’t pull the rest of his payment out of my bank account to pay for his Boyscout camp?  The deadline now has passed for payment so I have to explain to him now he can’t go?!?! Would you like to do that for me since you sincerely apologize and your doing so much to make it right! How? You can’t fix my issue and a soon to be disappointed boys issue.  Thanks Bb&t for failing your customers!

Doesn’t matter if the reason was due to damaged equipment or not. A good company will always have a solid disaster recovery plan so that customers only experience a temporary (2 hours or less) inconvenience while the disaster recovery system is switched over. My days of doing business with BB&T are over.

We love BB&T!  We have been with you guys for years.  You guys are awesome!  We also realize stuff happens!  We had some trouble over the weekend due to the outages but never once even remotely considered leaving BB&T!

I see where some corrections have already been done on my accounts.  As a retiree of BB&T, I really expected no less than Kelly King himself making this announcement.  Face it everyone,  computers rule our world, one little breakdown,  and no matter which company,  no business can be completed.

Thank you for fixing the problem! I can finally access everything now and everything in my account is back to order... just would have been nice to have a email about this or a phone call/ text message from BB&T. But I had to find out through Facebook first. 

I know mistakes can happen. Most likely gonna stay with BB&T... it could have happened to any bank... just hope it doesn’t happen again!

I think it is awesome how BB&T and their employees have worked so hard to make everything right.  I was told the employees worked late on Friday and on Saturday, even at branches not normally open.  AND, today they were at work again at 7:30 and will probably work late again today.  I think they should be rewarded for their extra efforts.  Thank you for your continued good service.  AND, no I am not an employee.

Awful costumer service during this catastrophe! My IRS federal return was rejected bc all of this and now I need to wait 6 weeks to receive my money and No one I have spoken to is willing to rectify the situation! I will be seeking legal action!

Thank you for your hard work and long hrs. I've been with bb&t for a long time and never had any problems. It affected me, but I'm not going to bad mouth them on Facebook or anywhere else.  Errors happen.   Our prayers are with you all.

People this can and dose happen to every bank.  If you have not been affected than you're lucky. They will make it right. Your not the only person it that has a problem. Give them time. Call your creditors and explain. Just be glad you didn't lose your money to stock fall ECT.

Since I sell silver and gold and have multiple accounts with BBT and rely upon computers in my business, I understand when the internet goes down and when our systems crash. It was a major outage that reminded me to have alternate bank accounts which we do have. I think it is important to have alternate cards, a secondary bank account and some cash on hand. It was an unfortunate event for the bank and its clients for sure.

I have banked with BB&T for about 100 years, well, close to that ! I live in Germany on an army base and have banked out of the country for the last 18 years, always using BB&T. You all have been great ! Thank you for all of your service over the years. I personally hate technology so I completely empathize with the issues that you are currently facing! Patience and using paper checks will just have to suffice! <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+0081>

Things happen and we are in the world of computers and technology. We are all only human and can not control what is not in our control. Appreciate all efforts from BBandT and employers trying to get matters resolved. Team work.

I'm not even a BB&T customer and this has royally screwed people outside of the account holder group.. my work uses direct deposit through signum.. who banks with BB&T.. I'd like to have money to do things.. I had the weekend off.. and did nothing.. because I have bills to pay. It's the end of the month and I have no clue when I'm getting paid.. Branch Bank &Tragedy.. because the Trust is gone.

Thank you to all the BB&T associate, back office and branch teams for working long hours, taking care of clients, many of you being effected by the system issue with your personal accounts but moving forward to help everyone.  YOU are appreciated!!!!!

Well what happened???  did you have to call the emergency federal reserve window to give BB&T an emergency bailout??? Never seen something like this last so long, good lesson for people who want a cashless society though.

But when I make a mistake you aren't so understanding. Like overdraft fees because of human error on my part...no help or refunding of fees that put me $72 in the negative and got me behind. Yes my error, no for understanding from BBT.

Kelly King is a man of his words.  Kelly often drive home at our end of the year update, that Customers satisfaction and integrity will not be compromise. Thanks Kelly<ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+0080> I’m on the local BB&T advisory board and it’s such a privilege serving the local BB&T bankers knowing they have that same mind set.

I agree with John Chatterton. While not in the tech field, I know enough about hardware failure risk to empathize with BB&T. I think they have been as open as can be considering the monumental task of the circumstances. I have no issue staying a customer.

Leaving BB&T this week as soon as I'm able to get my bb&t authorized checks cleared that was deposited 4 days ago. Lol ridiculous. I understand tech issues happen. But I woke up this morning and it's starting to become unacceptable. I will give another bank a try after 19 years.

In the 20 years I’ve banked with BBT, this has to be the 1st time I’ve heard of them having an issue like this. I’d say 1 time in 20 years is quite alright in my book and they figured it out and fixed immediately! Thanks for addressing so quickly!

BBT messed up some of my transactions to the point we're I couldn't use my debit card. It was a real headache calling there, because they want to do everything automated. During regular hours their phone system is a nightmare. During times like this it's a desaster. It is really scary too because some transactions were duplicated. I am in IT myself, but for a bank to mess up like this is simply scary. Once I finally got to talk to someone after almost an hour, the  support people were friendly and helpful at least.
Amazing to see a ceo step up like this and acknowledge the error and appologize. I dont recall any other company doing that when they have had an issue.

I would like to let you know, that due to all of the problems that your bank cost us this weekend, we have decided to close all of our accounts. We actually considered keeping our accounts, with BB&T, but after going to your Exeter Pennsylvania branch this past Saturday, I have to tell you it was the worst customer service experience we have ever encountered. I understand what you have been going through, but instead of just having a group of smiling faces there to try to comfort everyone's fears, you had a selection of tellers that just had miserable looking faces, short answers for customers, a branch manager that just walked around and did nothing and one woman in the back of the counter  that sounded like  a monotone Parrott every time someone walked in. You should have been better prepared for this incident. You clearly were not. Instead we were greeted by rude employees, called you 800 number and was on hold for 1 hour and 19 minutes before I hung up and  read nothing but negative all weekend from customers. It would be better for you to admit that you were not prepared for this and that you handled it wrong....but that would leave you open for liability issues...which means class action lawsuits
Shirley Newell this is what i was telling you I'm dealing with. Horrible! Madd people are also missing their income taxes (mine is missing too). Please can you double check with Chantel?
