This is why there is so much corruption crookedness fraud and more. This is why I say all bank, insurance companies, Stock market failure is imminent. What will these guys do afterwards? How will their god Satan help them next? No place to hide no place to run.

This has had me at home with no money or gas to go anywhere for 2 days and a negative balance of $161 bc y'all didn't register my deposit on friday. But yet it did tell me on my app that it went through and posted on my balance. I even have my account set so that it can not overdraw. Something is fishy. My banker has assured me that the money will be back soon, but this doesn't take away my hell of the last two days. And this better not cancel my plane tickets that the final charge was for, bc there were only two seats left for my daughter to see me for Easter and that charge is pending. Ridiculous. This is strike one. You get two. I can't be with a bank and not have access to my funds.

This has made me physically sick. Since last Thursday I haven't been able to get into my acct. Then, finally, Saturday it tells me I am short. Throughout the day , it keeps adding $35 shortage. I am , as of sunday night, as they claim ( not me ) , $338 short, because Every withdrawal the past few days was doubled !!! Now you tell me it should be fixed by Tuesday. It'll be a WEEK already on Thursday !!  I feel like it's the IRS saying, don't worry. We'll only take out a little bit. Trust us !

These things happen.  There was only one perfect person and we crucified him. Down here we just have to do our best. A little patience on our part.  I know a lot of work on yours. We will through this.

I was sort of a wreck for a few days as my account had a 0 balance. I an not rich but I knew better than  0 balance..  I waited a few days (3) until I tried again.  They admitted they made an error and any problems it caused, they will correct it.....Just give me a weak nerve pill, and I may get better as it sounds like they are not sure yet.   I so loved my old bank until this larger bank has been one headache after another,

This is becoming another apology for the declining customer service the BBT has been providing for at least the past three years... Listen to your customers... We have options other than BBT. Get into the 21st century with REAL TIME data and services. Smaller regional banks are doing a much better job than BBT...

What a big mess this has caused! I cant even figure out what my true balance is right now because I have double deposits, double debits, purchases that aren't even showing up. I can't even use my account right now because I don't know what the true balance is. I hope you guys get this mess situated asap and come up with measures for this to never happen again!

I work in IT and know things happen. I keep some cash on hand for just such emergencies. When I could see my accounts again online late Friday night, everything seemed fine. Only one purchase wasn’t reflecting and my debit card worked.

I sincerely appreciate everyone’s hard work over the weekend. However, as of last night, things actually got worse. 

My debit card was declined for a $6 McDonald’s purchase last night and this morning, my account showed that some purchases had been double-debited, with additional deposits made to cover the extra debits. <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+00B3>

Given that things are supposed to be getting better, this is worrisome. <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+009F> I have some cash, but I need to get groceries. Double-debiting $11.99 is one thing. But I can’t afford a double-debit of $200 (for a total of $400) for groceries...

I think EVERYONE should close there account. BB&T is obviously hiding something..Ive seen countless requests to give us details about what really happened and those questions are ignored or sidestepped. They try to placate us with cut and pasted replies that say nothing. Things happen , yes, but WHAT THINGS HAPPENED here? My account is now closed but is anyone's privacy and personal info at risk from this  " failure "/"cyber attack"?? We are frightened and  the bank is doing nothing to alleviate that. Being honest would be  a great place to start, but by now it would be a case of " too little too late".

This is the world we live in. Do people really think that with today’s technology and how everything is so dependent upon internet and computers that it should run smoothly? Of course along the way you will see things happen. Instead of bashing a company, realize that your car breaks down and it’s a big inconvenience. Do we blame the car companies when a starter goes out? No. The chairman put out a statement and apologized. He could of done nothing. BB&T has my full support. The only bank who hasn’t screwed me over.

BBT has been my bank since as long as I can remember, have my car note, checking and savings all with them, this was definitely a major blow but the first they've ever had, glad to See they are working it out as fast as they can. Special shout out to the Lake Mary, FL branch especially Sabina she's always a pleasure and even when I don't go into the bank personally for years she still greets me by name when I walk in, too notch employee!!

I knew nothing about all this and will pay attention when i look at my drafts and deposits. Here in Wilson NC i used to be treated like  a good customer, but lately i wonder, where did all that go? I miss the friendliness the prompt service. I go  there around 1:00 pm and one line is open, while one teller does some thing and another does something and another is sitting by the window that has no customers. And if i am real lucky the person in front of me makes a deposit for a business.
 Yes, i miss customer service, been with BB&T for over 40 years.
There seem to be new people as tellers all the time.

Wow a whole lot different over on twitter..alot of angry people! This feed here sounds like a lot of BB&T employees or friends of theirs cheering them on. .,what a big change over at twitter.  
Screen shot incase I get deleted...just saying check it out of you don't believe me. BB&T you seriously messed us up. Not doing anything to for us either.

This bank has gone to hell in a hand basket. Really scary things going on. Two weeks ago there was a problem with banking services. This week two unauthorized withdrawals from my account. I was told by the fraud department the withdrawals looked suspicious. It would've been nice to notify me before paying what looked suspicious. I was told someone cloned my debit card. Still waiting for my $520.00. This is scary.

It could happen to any bank. I recently moved to Burke County and transferred my accounts to BB&T. On Friday, I had written my daughter a check for 200$ to take to BB&T and cash. 
She doesn’t bank at BB&T and the lady at the desk was more than happy to cash the check it and since the system were down she didn’t charge her to cash it. The ladies that work at my bank are always happy to help.  
I went Friday afternoon and picked up things to make a snack basket to show my appreciation to the ladies. I told them this story and told them I appreciated them being so kind to her during their difficult day. I didn’t even tell the ladies my name. I didn’t want recognition for this. I just wanted them to know they were appreciated.
BB&T has been my Bank for years, I personally was not  inconvenienced in any way. Thank you for working so hard to make things right for those that did experience difficulties.

Thank you, Brenda! I had called my local bank about a transaction that was to be made late Thursday afternoon and then this happened with the BB&T computer system. Brenda called me before banking hours this morning to tell me that everything was taken care of in my account! Thank you so much Brenda for taking care of me in such A caring and professional manner!

Shooooot, this isn’t news. Here in Gastonia, NC McDonalds banks with BBT and at the same time every night, usually around 1030 or so they ALL yell “cash only”. One night I asked them why is this happening? They said they released their info to the bank and it takes a while for them to process. When I asked who their bank was, they said BBT. So I roll over to the ATM, insert my card, enter my pin, select cash and amount, here’s what I get: “We’re sorry, services are temporarily unavailable at this time. Please try again later”. So I’m not at all surprised to be hearing that there was a widespread outage and it’s lasted for days.

It was a big inconvenience Friday not to be able to pay a bill that was due that day, plus worried about my electric payment that hadn't been processed yet and wasn't able to do my usual Friday after work grocery shopping which I had to wait to do today Monday since I work in the city and live in the country.  But so far my account looks to be okay after you deducted for two transactions twice but deposited the duplicate back.  Crazy and a bit scary!

I have 3 teenagers that have all had small deposits show up in their accounts (like 10 deposits each that add to 30 or $40).   My accounts are fine.  One son deposited him paycheck on Friday still not showing at all.  He has tuition to pay.  When he finally got ahold of the fraud dept cause he was worried the small deposits were leading up to a hack, they were very rude to him.  On our end, 3 accounts are no where near fixed and my 16 year old already spent the money that didn't belong because he had no clue what was going on.

My account is so messed up right now. Duplicate debits, debits for transactions that were DECLINED, money taken out of one account to pay for supposed ISF for the other account that had plenty of money in there, and of course being charged to take that money out of said account. That’s not pending, already posted. I’m just gonna sit back until Tuesday or Wednesday, go over this mess with a fine tooth comb and waste another hour or 2 trying to get customer support to fix this mess.

This video is cute and all and the “apologies” and inconvenience but we didn’t have access to our money. 

More than a video is needed. I don’t know what but you guys sure don’t have a problem taking fees, where do I send my fee for your screwup? 

Hung up by customer service when I called on Friday. Is this what your institution is about?

This bank bought out our little home town bank and took the personal touch away when they did so. The tellers all knew us by name and greeted us as such . Now we walk in and it’s “welcome to BBT “ We are charged outrageous fees for everything. We’ve changed banks for the majority of our banking needs. The only thing left is a loan that we’re locked into otherwise we’d be totally out of this rip off of a company

This is 1 reason you should keep cash available.  What in the hell are you gonna do when another country attacks the power grid and everything goes down? Everyone needs to plan ahead. As if a severe winter storm was forecasted. You go by milk and bread.  Everyone needs to stock up on canned foods, bottled water. And always have some cash on hand. 
     People rely on computers way to much this day and time.  Guess what? Computers fail daily.   I'm going to be honest. The only problem we had was my husbands and my son's direct deposit didn't go in Thursday night/ Friday morning. Our tax money was deposited Thursday . But my son only has 5 dollars to his name , in his account.  But he does have sense enough to plan ahead he always has. He keeps gas in his truck. And keeps extra gas in a can. So does my husband.  
     I'm sticking with bb&t.   Happy with them.

I was calm about all of this in the beginning because things happen. But it has been to long and funds are being misplaced, put into others accounts. I woke up the other morning to $500 more in our accounts than it should be. I know that is some of someone's direct deposit. But it sure does look tempting to take it and open another account. I'm going to let it sit til everything is straight.
Thank you BB&T for the updates. Things go wrong, things break, stuff does not last forever, even though we would like them to. So it does happen.

I really haven’t had any problems using my debit card all this weekend. There was some slow debits, and a deposit on my acct that I didn’t do. But they took it off within 20 mins. I used it everywhere I went and it worked fine.The only thing I noticed was my available balance has changed 4 times in 2 hours and I haven’t used my card and when I went to the atm it would only allow me to take out $260 not $500

I think what worries me is that I know the secure places the data is kept and how high the security is, also that there is backup and backups to the backup. So just  hoping this isn't anything to worry about for the future. I have been with BB&T since they took over Lanier Bank & Trust. Great personnel that are hometown friends. I know other banks have had breaches before and I have always trusted BB&T.  Thank you for keeping us updated.

Thank you, I live in Massey, Md. Your bank in Millington as referred me to a different PNC  Bank to cash a check drawn to from my Jackson Financial Stock Account.  I have had my house Mortgage through your bank since 1971. I want to open a savings account and receive a Visa Debit Card. I am home with health care and currently due to medications can’t drive. I still coach at Saint Andrew’s School in Middletown. My home is Four minutes from the bank. I can’t understand an area that has so many workers at the nursery’s, farms, contractors etc. and no car insurance, tags and receive other freedoms and  do not have the problem with any local, county, or state services.I have for years provided my services to Millington youth, men’s soccer, softball, ....lifetime sports throughout the Eastern Shore and Delaware .Its very hard to justify the problems I having with the Millington Bank,

BB&T has always been a wonderful help to me,my family and my business! I have been the executor of three estates and one of many reasons I use BB&T is the way I was treated at a time when thousands of dollars was being withdrawn to form an estate account. If you ever want to find out how a bank treats a customer, look closely at that time! Also thank them for not financing eminent domain matters! All people and companies that do anything makes mistakes, but the good ones fix them and are accountable! Thank you BB&T for being that bank! <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+008E>

Stop buying small community banks you guys have no idea how to treat those customers.  As of Thursday I will no longer bank with BBT after 20 years of banking with a community bank system that you purchased.  Run don't walk from BB&T.  The mere fact that a bank this size has an outage shows how much they care about the people.  Why were these data centers not duplicated or triplicated in different geographical locations?  This is 2018 an an outage like this should never happen.

I personally thank you all for working very hard to get my life and others back to normal. It means a lot to me and others that you kept us all in the loop of this outage. I am assuming you all are doing your best to assure this doesn’t happen again. If anything of this magnitude occurs again, could you please send out an email to make everyone aware of  it before we have to find out on the evening news.

This is all BS! I’m sooo frustrated that I can’t have access to MY money! It’s stressful and embarrassing ! I have bills to pay with my hard earned money and a family to support! We have been hearing this for the past 3 Days! It’s such an in inconvenience ! I will be closing my account after this is resolved because you guys have definitely lost my trust!

Funny this shows up today.  My 86 year old mother's account was royally messed up....double payments made out of her account yet no record of those double payments on her statement or on your end.  We know the double payments were made because the borough returned a check for over $1500.00 with a note telling her that she "double paid" her taxes.  She did not.....BB&T did.  The amount of the double payment wasn't even the same amount as the 1st, legitimate payment she made.  We still haven't straightened out the mess.  When she mentioned taking her business elsewhere she was told by staff, "OK."  We have an appointment today to close her account.

When the wealthiest bankers and financiers decide the time is right, something like this will happen and anyone with money in the banks will lose it permanently. If BBT come back on line, this will have been a test for the big one coming. That is if this isn't the one. Supposed to happen on a Friday!

Don’t bank with them always had a hard time with this bank and the tellers always were rude... or they seemed like the didn’t like being there... and they will take your money but when I tried cashing a two party check it seemed to take forever for them to cash it...and once a friend of mine wrote a check out to pay his help.... 2400.00 they gave him 24000.00... nope.... not the best in banking....

Yes, it's inconvenient and down right scary not to have the access to our online banking and money over the weekend.  I love BB&T and know they're going to make right with their customers.  I know we have had them catch fraudulent activity on several occasions and am grateful for the outcome.  I'm grateful that other than freaking out for a few hours I wasn't inconvenienced as much as others.  We sure take our secure internet/banking world for granted.  THANK YOU BB&T!

This can happen to any bank at any given time, anywhere. Doesn't make any difference what State or County u live in. BB&T is and has been a good bank with my family and we're planning on staying with them. They've always worked any problems we've had out. We're staying where we're at. I trust their company and what their doing. Give them time to take care of this issue. After all they have a lot of customers, just like any other bank and they want to make sure everything is correct. God Bless everyone, everywhere

While I heard there was a problem at the end of last week, I was tuned out to news and facebook this weekend and didn't realize there had been an issue with my account until today. 5 transactions (totaling $300) had been debited twice but the extra transactions had already been credited back. Thank you for the great communication and the quick response.

My husband was embarrassed at the grocery store. His card declined even though we had plenty of money in the account to cover it. We could not get anyone from BB&T to answer the phone to release the funds. We had to leave the groceries. We had no way of accessing our funds all day Saturday. Sunday everything was fine. We almost feel we have to shop somewhere else because of the embarrassment.

Thanks for owning it and taking responsibility. I’ve been with BB&T since you acquired KFNC bank which acquired Elkridge National Bank, early 90’s. I’ve had a few accounts with you and my husband is with you now, as well. Please continue to have integrity and respect for your clients. Thanks.

This bank is nothing like the Bank of Kentucky that it bought it is the worst thing I have ever saw and no it does not care about its clients it's out for that Almighty dollar it can make off of you I do not recommend it for anybody if you make a deposit of Cash Money it does not show up until the next day "why "so they can make money off of it , I put money in there cash so I wouldn't get overdrawn but they wouldn't put it cleared till the next day so my account was overdrawn and they could get that $36 a charge, they are a greedy Bank

This is one of the reasons I left BB&T, but the other reason was because they kept sending me new debit cards saying that my account was compromised.  Not to mention my local branch is extremely slow.  And they charged a lot more fees than the other local bank here.  My daughter has an account with BB&T, and I have convinced her to move her account to another bank.  Yes, things happen, but out of all the banks in our area, BB&T is the only one that has had THIS many problems.

My only concern is that it doesn't end up over withdrawing my account, because the balances are so messed up.  I know it's hard for any of us not on the banking side to understand, so I'm trying to wrap my brain around how I am going to check to make sure my money was properly deposited back into my account and praying I don't over withdraw like I said before.  I am still waiting for pending debits to come out, that should have already been taken out.
I am changing banks. BB&T has been difficult for me. Finally going to leave them soon as I get other things resolved.
This is an example of great ethical response to customers in the event of a problem.  BB&T is to be complimented!

I understand that things can unfortunately cause a little disruption.... But you are closing the Ft Ashby WV branch where I do my banking and have done so for many years. There are three banks in our little town but I have stuck with BB&T through it all. Now you're closing our branch and I am going to have to switch banks because I shouldn't have to drive 20 miles out of my way to do  my banking

Nothing about the events that just took place; you have done a good job getting things back to normal. I do however have a complaint about the closing of your branch bank in Fort Ashby, West Virginia. This closing will affect a lot of seniors who cannot go to other branches for their banking needs because of distance and no way to get to them. We would deeply appreciate you keeping this branch open. Thank you. Customer for over 25 years.

When you have stuff, stuff breaks. Yes it was an inconvenience but the customer service, updates etc. show me that I’m with a good bank and you will continue to have my business. So remember, 2 is 1 and 1 is none. Build a few fail safe backups in this go around. Thank you for your courtesy and professionalism displayed at my branches.

I have a lot of confidence in BBandT to solve and resolve this major outage. So far my acct. is ok. I know for a fact that BB&T is working diligently to have things back up and working normally. Patience is the key in situations like this. Thanks for being the best bank around in my opinion. p.s I'm not an employee just a satisfied customer.

They bought a bank that I was happy with.  After a couple of months a new bank started to create big crazy charges and it took me almost a year to close my account with them. They refused to close the account claiming that it must be exactly zero balance and did not want to take few cents as a donation from me. Finally I got someone reasonable and he worked it out and closed it. Phew..

Thanks for the apologies.  I notice that BB&T is attempting to respond to everyone - so, while we have your attention: you guys really need to update some things online.  Worst small business online bill paying system I have ever experienced in a national bank.  Not a big BOA fan but their system is far, far superior to BBT.  If your system were better I would shift all my business accounts from 2 states to you.   However,I reluctantly struggle with just one BBT account because I need an interstate account in a small Ga town.  Lots of room for improvement at BB&T.

These things happen, online systems fail at times, hey even Google has had problems. I love the responsible way in which BB&T has addressed this, via the CEO himself, explaining the problem, presenting his excuses for the inconveniences, offering to reimburse any charges due to this and assuring that they will work hard for this not to happen again. I give them a lot of credit for that. And I must say, that I am a very satisfied customer of BB&T. Their service is A1!!

Apparently different people are having different problems. The only problem I had was not being able to check my balance online or by phone. I knew "about" how much I had, but was just checking as I usually do at random times. I was still able to use my debit card as usual. My account today appears normal and deposit and debit transactions are showing up like they should. I hate to hear others are having such a hard time. I feel sure they will handle this appropriately, The bills I paid online are showing up as well, and were paid. It hasn't been a big issue with me. I wish all of you the best. It seems some are having more serious issues than I did, I have no idea why though. All is well with me and my accounts.

As a client and retired employee (28 years), I have to say that I really appreciate the kinds words of our CEO and I also appreciate that the technical staff worked round the clock to resolve this issue.  My accounts are all fine now.  I noticed the double entries but just waited for it to all wash out and it did.  Good job BB& T as always.

I've been with BB&T going on 9yrs now and Love them. I have no problem i can wait to see my account tuesday as i've been watching to make sure i dont overdraw lol. Everyone at silver springs and forest of ocala BB&T have been wonderful. Thank you for letting us all know whats up.

my accounts are ok, but what really bugs me about the bank at 2nd & Walnut Streets in Shamokin is the ATM, it is always "out of order" & it is in the most inconvenient place. Besides being so low I can't reach it from my car, I have to get out & almost get on my knees to see the numbers on the pad, all the while holding up the line for the drive thru. You need to figure out a better location for your ATM

My care was declined for $20 at Walmart of all places. I knew I had money so I went to the instore ATM and was able to get the money out but of course had to pay the non network fees. I already put in an email request this AM for my fees to be reversed. But I also see charges that were there last week, not posted today so it seems I have more money than I do. Thank God I keep an accurate ledger or I'd be out here spending money I really don't have. LOL

When you only have enough money to pay bills with little left over, & since last Thursday, you either can't get into your acct, or, when you do, finally, after 4 days, your balance keeps showing negative with more & more overdraft

Well for starters Thank you for the explanation and the apology. I don't know of any other institution that has done this even the ones that were hacked. It picked a crap time to break being tax time and all. My return should be there today or tomorrow.  I have been with your bank for a number of years and have been generally pleased with your service. I have not been able to get to the branch because of work. Really need to get on line and balance everything out. I am a little OCD when it comes to checking the account. I know you're doing your best but please hurry.

Thanks for getting things back up and running. I had very few issues during this time, however, perhaps this comes as a warning for the need of redundancy in the system. This minor event personifies our vulnerabilities with our current systems.

Would be nice if BB&T would realize that accidents happen & not be so quick to charge their loyal customers of many years fees so quickly when it is us that has a problem instead of you.
It has been several days & $1,500 still gone out of my account & not returned yet.

Hey, Everybody makes mistakes.  I can forgive this one,  but if I find out many months down the road that there was a security breach and my info may have been taken,  I am going to feel much different about BB&T.  I hope we are getting the complete truth about this.

I was a Susquehanna customer. They were acquired by BB&T. It took over 2 weeks until I could access my money. Not only could I not get through on their phone, I went into an office and they couldn't get through to their own help desk. I have never had as much trouble with a bank as I had with BB&T. I now use FNB

At some point during this debacle my debit card was flagged as stolen. It wasn't....I still was trying to use it. I kept waiting, thinking this would sort itself out as your system came back online. Finally I went into my local branch, where I was told my card was flagged. Had to request a new one.

Thank you, BB&T for being so honest and upfront with everything that has happened!  And no matter what others think or say, I've never had any other bank agree to fix charges that they applied due to a service outage!  Thanks again for the wonderful customer service and help that ya'll have given us during this very stressful time!  And yes, I live paycheck to paycheck just like anyone else!
The last thing We need to hear is some Millionaire telling us everything  will be alright. I'm sure he wasn't panicking and trying to cover Bills all weekend....

I have banked with BB& T for many years and never had a problem with their services. I have never seen this until now so I know it is those computers we have to use that malfunctions and sad but we have to deal with these type issues. Thanks BB&T for being a great bank and protecting my account.

Thank you for your heartfelt message and praying that everything will be back to normal soon. My account is fine now. My BB&T bank has always been like family and that feels good. I am not just a bank account there, I am a friend. <3

Wow. I thought I had trouble with bbt electronic services when I had an account there (until last year). This just confirms all the reasons behind me taking my funds to go play elsewhere. So sorry to all who have to deal with this...

Things happen!  Sometimes technology just sucks!!  Bb&t has been quick to keep everyone updated with this matter!  I'm confident they will make everything alright with accounts; How however, it does take time.  My account is back up, I have to admit,  I do have one minor issue since they deducted a purchase twice,  it everything was back for us on Saturday.  Thanks for keeping us informed!!

Well evidently your system is still screwed up.  I am not seeing deposits, withdrawals, transfers online. Many missing and now you are showing my savings account negative without the back up detail as of 10 minutes ago.  I also see an auto transfer from checking to savings on a Friday when in fact those auto transfers are always on a Monday.  I am sure yet another fee is coming out now tomorrow, and it is all because your systems are so screwed up  I will be changing banks asap.  This is unacceptable.  A week after your major breakdown and you still don't have things corrected.

I think BB&T handled this well.  I probably wouldn't have even noticed, except I tried to check my direct deposit on the app and it didn't work.  They had the services I use back up and running pretty quickly.  Nice job.

I understand this is frustrating for a lot of people. It is frustrating for me as a mom who works 2 jobs just to make ends meet and lives paycheck to paycheck, yet I can honestly say out of all the banks that I have had the pleasure..or displeasure... of dealing with over the years BB&T is definitely one of the best. I have been with them when they transitioned and the only time I ever had a problem with my account my personal branch got right on it gave me a temporary credit and got it sorted out (not my fault but a company unauthorized taking money out). I had corporate call me to make sure everything was sorted out and explain what happened on their end that took care of the matter. You really couldn’t ask for more. Can we all be human for a minute and realize how embarrassing this must be for them. Machines malfunction computers break down but to assure their customers that they are doing the best they can and as quickly as they can you can’t really ask for more. Kudos to all the men and women who are missing meals or time with their families to work overtime and on heir days off to get this problem solved some of us do appreciate you.

I've been a customer since the transition from UCB... Never heard of this kind of issue until now. My direct deposit went in early Saturday night, rather than early Friday as usual. Thank you for taking care of this, and as of right now, I don't think I have any double debit purchases.

After what I personally experienced a few years earlier with BB&T  related to my targeting by the Feds that continues to this day and the good old boys in the state of North Carolina - never trust them with much ever again!. The latest issues had no effect on me personally this time to my knowledge. 

I have a long memory!  Perhaps Karma exists after all! 

Ronald N. Day 
American Resistance to Tyranny!

Customer Service at the Leland, NC Branch is absolutely the best. They know almost everyone by name, always act happy to see you and seem to recall something on a personal level with almost every client. If anyone needs help with their customer service skills the Leland Branch is the answer!!

I have had a BB&T account for a long time, and I also own a business account with BB&T. This outage almost broke me. The worst thing is that there was no communication about this issue. I travel for work and thank God I have another account with another bank because that is the only way I was able to live. Not a happy customer. Seriously considering closing my accounts and moving to another bank.

Ok, but what is the disaster recovery plan when one system goes down?  Most banks and businesses have a secondary system ready to kick right into place.  This made us very nervous that this is not what appears to have happened, it looked to us like there was no disaster recovery backup.

I got double charged multiple times and it maxed out my credit limit on the over draft and I was still charged fees for it. Slowly the double charge is being reimbursed but not the fees that were charged. I believe I am done with BBT. I have had on going problems for a year or so and I wasn’t even aware of an outage until just now.

I am a 3rd generation BBT customer. Fixing to make my 17 year old daughter the 4th G. One thing I know is that BBT is the most personal Bank in my area and has the Most friendly employees. They are always willing to help. Things happen, I for one appreciate how you guys handled this uncontrollable situation. Keeping us up dated and working with us to get things back to normal! Keep up the good work BBT.

$36 over draft fee is ridiculous. My husband has been wanting me to switch banks for the longest time. His bank, SECU, does not charge outrageous fees. I have a second separate account with SECU, and am eventually going to close my BB&T account. You make money off of people going through hard times.

I don't think it was just BB&T! I have a different bank and Saturday into Sunday i got declined at 2 stores and insufficient funds out of the ATM when I had money in there. And when I tried to call or get online to check my balance it said services unavailable.

BB&T has always taken care of my family and I will continue to support them. Things happen, but what's more important to me is that I am being addressed SINCERELY regarding the issue, leaving me to feel like more than just a bank account.

Thank you for your efforts to make things right. Inconvenient things happen when dealing with computers, but I know BB&T is not ok with that and they are striving to correct it. Customer service is everything. I am loyal because BB&T has been loyal.

I don’t use a debit card except in extreme circumstances. I use cash from teller machines. This forced me to have to go to another bank to get funds. I was charged a fee twice. I don’t have a problem with their fee. However, I would be very disappointed if I am charged a fee at BB&T also.

I'm glad to hear you all are recovering! All of my banking through BB&T is online (there are no branches or ATMs in my area), so I was very worried when I heard about the outage. Still, I had no problems with my accounts over the weekend. You can only be a stronger, better bank through this! Looking forward to future business with BB&T!

Thank you for your prompt action sir. Also, thank you for all that was done immediately after my daughter made a deposit at the Brunswick Forest ATM on Thursday afternoon. Things will happen from time to time that are simply out of anyone’s control. How BB&T has responded speaks volumes about who this bank is.
With much appreciation.

I just think it's odd I've been getting charged atm fees at a surcharge free atm and now that systems are back up I can finally see why I keep getting overdraft fees over $2. They were completely invisible before. So after paying $120 in overdraft fees because I hardly use the account and finally received mail notification after a week and a half of accruance, I'll finally be cancelling Friday.

Thank you for your words! People need to remember electronics crash and have sudden outages for no reason.  That’s why it’s so important to have a back up plan. A little cash at home for times like this. I have no doubt BB&T will make good any any burdens their customers experienced. I too was affected. My local branch kept a lane open until 7 pm to help.

Sure... it was a problem but for me it was an inconvenience not a disaster. But what has greatly impressed me - and convinced me that I made the right decision when I came to BB&T from Wachovia has been the way the entire bank from the CEO to the local team has gotten in front of the issues and spectacular customer service. Having worked with computer systems for many years, I know they do break (a good hot site might be in order) but how you handle those issues has truly set you apart.

But no one will answer the phone! I've tried calling 3 times today and stayed on hold forever with no answer. I also pushed 2 for a call back and no call. I sincerely hope this is resolved by tomorrow because I need to deposit a check and am scared to because they have stuff "pending" that shouldn't be and afraid they will take all money as an overdraft. This was/is awful. I will be switching banks. Usually when something like this happens, a customer gets a call or email letting them know. Not after the fact. This was handled very unprofessional and the teams at Stanleyville branch and another branch were rude and no understanding!!

Well I was on hold for 45 minutes talk to the woman on the phone because I was nine dollars in the hole I was going to get charged 4 overdraft fees because I couldn’t view my balance all the pending charges came in didn’t know I was overdrafted I went by the branch made a deposit to cover the shortage so I wouldn’t get 4 overdraft fees but all worked out well got a $25 credit for the hassle so I’m all good now but it was kind of stressing there for a while

As an long time customer it is frustrating but I also know anything can happen at anytime.With computers it's scary of what can happen at any moment .These problems can or could happen with any Bank.Hopefully things will be all up to date & corrected in the next couple of days & not happen again.

My spouse and I have been with BB&T since 1973, starting with the old Southern National Bank in Henderson NC.  Most of our transactions are done online so it was a bit of inconvenience to have the website down. But I’ve checked everything this morning and all seems ok.

We have the best clients! Even under stress from system issues, they were kind and understanding. We did whatever we could to ease the pain, but our clients made it all worthwhile. I cannot emphasize enough how amazing our BB&T folks were during this very difficult time.

BB&T u have been having technical issues and malfunctions going on for the last month or so . As a customer for over 20 years, this is the first time I've experienced a problem like this with BBT.  And, as a technology person, and having worked for a bank for about 7 years, I understand how these things can happen.  I noted the problem almost immediately, and checked on it non-stop throughout the outage.  I could only assume what had happened, and know exactly the pain to both bring the systems online, recover, and then the tedious nature of making it right by sometimes manually looking at every account.  I did note this morning that the one fee which I received was already credited back, and everything looks right with my account.  As I was checking into this, I said to myself...hmm...the only thing missing now would be an explanation and an apology...and whatdayaknow...what should appear before my very eyes.  So, all told...sure, it was painful and a little worrisome...but, in my eyes, it was handled as well as could be expected.  I, for one, am not put off by the experience...things like this will happen.  The ongoing communication and updates, as well as the personal and sincere nature of the message above were both top notch in my book.  BBT has not lost a customer here...they've solidified the relationship!  Thank you!

All of us who bank with THIS bank was negatively affected because of a "malfunction" that lasted only a short time, however, some people are still dealing with the effects of all the banking confusion at the data centers, branches and corporate offices. What's left me terrified is, if they were not prepared for such an incident as this and are bewildered about what to do and have no answers to what caused this, (that their making public, anyway) then are, we as customers, and completely dependant and trusting of these institutions,  prepared when this happens again? Society will break down completely. Imagine all banking being affected everywhere because of natural events or terrorist attacks. We need to have a plan as individuals to know what we're going to do just to help our families have food, water and shelter and stay safe. Forget about bills and business,  because if something happens that last for weeks or months, we're all in trouble. Some things are beyond control and we shouldn't be so naive in thinking that anyone can prevent it. Who knows? Maybe this was a test by powers that be. We all need to wake up people. We need to try and be prepared when this or even worse happens as much as possible.

Okay this may be a long post, and I'm not sure how many will read it. 
1) the website was only down for a few hours. But people have multiple over draft fees. I don't understand how that happened. Do people not keep an actual ledger anymore. I've never had any issues with them and my personal ledger always matches their online documentation. It has been off 3 times by a few cents, because I made a error, not them.
2) Technology fails all the time, even for banks. So don't wait until last minute to pay your bills etc. Pay them in advance and always have emergency cash.
3) I don't do automatic withdrawal personally, so maybe your struggle is different than mine. I get paid, then pay all my bills for the next 2 weeks. Maybe the glitch wouldn't have affected you if you planned better. It was only down for a few hours.

I'm sure I'm going to get people upset by my post, but oh well. I enjoy banking with them, and if this was a make or break for you, then find another bank.

I have called twice this morning and requested a call back. I have not received a call back either time. BB&T made funds available and then “lost” them. Due to BB&T’s failure to rectify the situation or properly communicate, I have filed a formal complaint against them with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau. Their phone # is 855-411-2372. You can file a complaint online at consumerfinance.gov. The representative I spoke with was very alarmed to hear that BB&T had accepted funds, made them available to me, and then “lost” them. She said the only time this is ok is if the deposit did not  have sufficient funds (ie: a bounced check). If it were the other way around and we had made a mistake, BB&T would have charged overdraft fees without hesitation. I encourage all of you who have been affected to file a complaint against them as well. It’s bad enough that this is happening. What’s even worse is that they won’t even answer the phone to talk to you.

Warning::::: DO NOT BANK HERE. I JUST OPENED MY ACCT LESS THAN A WEEK AGO AND CAN ALREADY SAY THIS IS ABSOLUTELY IN BOLD THE WORST BANK EVER!!!!!!! When opening a checking and savings account, I was prompted to deposit $50 into each account with my debit card from my other bank in order to make a deposit. So I used my debit card and deposited $50 into each account-checking and savings. They only put $50 into the checking account and as a result when using my card I went into -$26. I called them at 11 PM to tell them that I could not figure out how to add funds with my debit card to correct the balance and bring it out of the negative and was trying to do so by midnight so I would not receive over withdraw fees. The initial employee I spoke with said I could only add funds at the branch which at that point was closed. They also told me the cut off time for charges was 9pm, not midnight which I have never even heard of before. I explained my concern that I was never informed that using a debit card to add funds was only an option when making an initial deposit and not available in the future. He agreed and stated that it was a “good question,” but said he could not solve my problem and help me fix my balance to prevent any fees, so I asked to speak to a supervisor. Upon speaking to the supervisor -no exaggeration - he would not let me speak and continued to talk over me. When I expressed my feelings in regards to not being informed when signing up that I could not use my debit card in the future to add funds he responded “well it didn’t say you could either, did it?” I was so appalled that it took me a minute to gather my thoughts because I literally thought I was dreaming to be treated like this by not only any employee—but a supervisor. I haven’t even gotten to the worst part.... in response to his rude comment, I asked him if he would please allow me speak and stop speaking over me so I could try to prevent getting charged $216 yes that is correct ($36 per transaction up to 6 transactions a day from what he told me) even though I opted out of being able to over withdraw, and he HUNG UP ON ME!!!!!!!!!!! I am still in disbelief as I type this and I will do every single possible thing regardless if I have to spend every second of my day to make sure that this never happens to anyone else who signs up with this piece of you know what scam artist that they call a “business.” I will report them to the Better Business Bureau, I will plaster it on Facebook, I will plaster it on Twitter, I will plastered on telephone poles if I have to because I am DISGUSTED and because they are simply deserving of it as well as the innocent VICTIMS that they refer to as customers. I hope to God that they record their conversations so that they have it when I take this further. I don’t care if it’s for a penny or a million dollars, NO ONE DESERVES TO BE TREATED LIKE I WAS TONIGHT AND I WILL MAKE SURE NO ONE ELSE EXPERIENCES WHAT I DID. BB&T You should be utterly ashamed of yourself.

Just want to say I appreciate BB&T for getting the word out to their customers that they are working on the problem. And also that they will reimburse anyone for any charges or late fees due to this problem. I am a payroll manager and I know it has been very frustrating for our employees that their deposits weren't in their accounts on Friday. Me being one of those employees. But I advise people to try and do banking at more than one bank. If you can put at least $10 every payday in another account at a different bank you'll have some cushion money for any issues that come up. Or just keep a little jar with cash in it  for those emergencies. There's no system that's foolproof and will never break down. The problem is people rely too much on technology these days. They don't know what to do when things stop working. I know this will definitely make people think about how to do things differently in the future.

BB&T, I completely understand technical issues.  I deal with them everyday.  However, we have been told by several sources it was ONE piece of equipment that brought your institution to it's knees. I was also angry when I went into a branch today to cancel my credit card (it had a zero balance for 3 years) and your employee not only tried to justify your position by saying "This could happen at any bank" she also said "If you move to member one, they have terrible customer service ratings".  My response: so will you.  Close the account and give me my cash.  

Member One gave me 200 dollars for opening a free account.  Your worker told me you would give us 25 dollars for the inconveniences.  You are losing in every way.  
Your name is Branch Bank & Trust.  The trust is broken.  Even if it wasn't a cyber attack, there is a massive incompetence in your IT department.  Lack of redundant systems is unexcusable.  And using the excuse "These things happen.." Are you serious?  They really don't.  This has never happened to me.  Wells Fargo never had an issue like this.

This was a cyber attack that stole the funds from their payday float account.  They hold all the outgoing payments in one account to accrue interest from Tuesday through Thursday.   They are scrambling trying to find a way to cover the loss without going public.  I do not expect anyone to see direct deposits on Monday and the FEDs will be stepping in to clean up this mess.  This would explain why all account activity has been restored up until Thursday. They currently do not have the funds to cover the outgoing direct deposits. This will end up being the biggest bank robbery of all time.  Look for the movie in theaters by 2019.

For everyone who had some serious issues....I understand and I am so sorry you were so frustrated.  My husband and I work in the same place and both use bb&t for direct deposit so it impacted us as well.  Maybe because we are older and a bit wiser, we use TWO banks to avoid just this sort of problem.  As an added bonus the other bank we use posts that part of our pay Wednesday night instead of Friday morning and offers overdraft protection.  Now....let me just say, it there had been a really bad weather situation like.....oh lets say a hurricane (we have had that in recent past AND the floods) and there is a massive power outage....you still would not have been able to get cash or use debit...to that end you really need to keep a supply of emergency non perishable items and a small amount of cash.  Before you jump my behind and tell me you can't afford to do that....look at the events of the past three days and ask yourself how you can afford NOT TO.  $5 A week in your sock drawer will add up pretty fast if you don't touch it.  Its not likely to happen again but wouldn't you rather be ready for it?

BB&T:
I appreciate your friendly positive posts 12 hours ago about how everything that has crashed over the last 72 hours will be remidied tonight, yet my debit card gets declined this evening when there is exponentially  more money in the account than I was needing for the transaction. Lucky for me, I was only a mile from my house and had the cash available. But what if I were on vacation this week and was using my debit card all week? What if I was taking my family out for a birthday dinner and my 200 dollar meal was declined and I had no other form of payment? 

What I fail to understand, and by all means, someone is welcome to call and explain it to me from your corporate office, is why you don't  have redundant server systems to fail over to when something happens? It's no secret data centers experience equipment failures, but that's why you have back up systems located in other data centers that allow you to fail over to a stable system until your main is restored. 

You are in control of millions of families financial security, mine included, along with the business finances of thousands of small businesses, mine included, and it is very disturbing to see what a nightmare your company has allowed to transpire over the last three, going on four days. Even more disturbing, is the fact that over those almost four days, I have not received one call from BB&T, locally, or from a corporate call center, warning me that I may have issues using funds that I assumed should be available. I had to find out at the point of sale and that is simply unacceptable. 

Respectfully,
Scott Jones

Bye BB&T. Truly hope you make this right with ALL that have been affected by this SNAFU, currently, and the unforeseen circumstances that may occur due to the outage in the future.  Zero updates of true substance is very concerning and "Equipment Malfunction" really does not make sense unless it was catastrophic (i.e. wind, fire, water, earthquake . . . acts of god) Having worked in many "mission critical" data centers over the decades I understand the pressure placed on the technicians, field engineers, systems engineers, and the like during a crisis of this magnitude. ( Don't shove all of the weight on the technicians please ) "Equipment malfunction" happens. Contracting or "farming out" the maintenance of our hardware infrastructure (networking and computing equipment) comes with a risk. That risk includes not being in complete control over the maintenance and operability of the "equipment" Typically this service is set out to a bidding process and awarded to a contractor that assumes the risk and graded on performance and uptime. Critical parts "equipment" are typically placed on-site and throughout the country in strategic locations to be dispatched quickly to the area requiring them by the contractor ( the technician in the end.)  I think we all understand you are doing your best to restore service to us, your consumers, but please don't cover up what's going on by placing all of the burden to the catch all "equipment malfunction" and the technicians in the trenches.  Not good business.  You're a fool if you think this will make things easier on BB&T and retain your clients by covering up the true problem(s).  The only way to prevent this type of situation in the future is to shine a flood light on it, locate the root cause of it, share the information about it, correct it, and finally update your contingency plans accordingly.  Thanks for listening..

Warning::::: DO NOT BANK HERE. I JUST OPENED MY ACCT LESS THAN A WEEK AGO AND CAN ALREADY SAY THIS IS ABSOLUTELY IN BOLD THE WORST BANK EVER!!!!!!! When opening a checking and savings account, I was prompted to deposit $50 into each account with my debit card from my other bank in order to make a deposit. So I used my debit card and deposited $50 into each account-checking and savings. They only put $50 into the checking account and as a result when using my card I went into -$26. I called them at 11 PM to tell them that I could not figure out how to add funds with my debit card to correct the balance and bring it out of the negative and was trying to do so by midnight so I would not receive over withdraw fees. The initial employee I spoke with said I could only add funds at the branch which at that point was closed. They also told me the cut off time for charges was 9pm, not midnight which I have never even heard of before. I explained my concern that I was never informed that using a debit card to add funds was only an option when making an initial deposit and not available in the future. He agreed and stated that it was a “good question,” but said he could not solve my problem and help me fix my balance to prevent any fees, so I asked to speak to a supervisor. Upon speaking to the supervisor -no exaggeration - he would not let me speak and continued to talk over me. When I expressed my feelings in regards to not being informed when signing up that I could not use my debit card in the future to add funds he responded “well it didn’t say you could either, did it?” I was so appalled that it took me a minute to gather my thoughts because I literally thought I was dreaming to be treated like this by not only any employee—but a supervisor. I haven’t even gotten to the worst part.... in response to his rude comment, I asked him if he would please allow me speak and stop speaking over me so I could try to prevent getting charged $216 yes that is correct ($36 per transaction up to 6 transactions a day from what he told me) even though I opted out of being able to over withdraw, and he HUNG UP ON ME!!!!!!!!!!! I am still in disbelief as I type this and I will do every single possible thing regardless if I have to spend every second of my day to make sure that this never happens to anyone else who signs up with this piece of you know what scam artist that they call a “business.” I will report them to the Better Business Bureau, I will plaster it on Facebook, I will plaster it on Twitter, I will plastered on telephone poles if I have to because I am DISGUSTED and because they are simply deserving of it as well as the innocent VICTIMS that they refer to as customers. I hope to God that they record their conversations so that they have it when I take this further. I don’t care if it’s for a penny or a million dollars, NO ONE DESERVES TO BE TREATED LIKE I WAS TONIGHT AND I WILL MAKE SURE NO ONE ELSE EXPERIENCES WHAT I DID. BB&T You should be utterly ashamed of yourself.

BB&T knew this was happening yet they did nothing to stop their customers from attempting to withdraw money from the atm machine. I tried to get cash out of my local BB&T atm machine in the midst of this debacle, before I was aware of the problem. There was no sign on the atm machine to warn me not to use it. The money was debited from my account but BB&T’s ATM machine did not give me my cash. BB&T knew that this was an ongoing issue, yet they did not even bother to put up an “out of order” sign on the atm machine.  I sat and watched in utter shock as customer after customer repeatedly attempted to withdraw cash without success, the money immediately was immediately debited from their account, but NO cash was forthcoming from the atm machine. I drove to another BB&T branch nearby to see if it was happening there too and it was! No out of order sign on the atm. Customer after customer trying to withdraw cash. Each one then parking and going into the bank to find out what they could do to get to their money. I watched this go on for 25 minutes. All the while BB&T did nothing to stop them. Each customer had to then go into the bank to inquire as to when they could get their money. Each was told to fill out an affidavit and an investigation would be completed that could take up to 45 days. Meanwhile you are without your money until the “investigation” is completed for a problem that was created by BB&T in the first place! Come on BB&T ! What is REALLY going on here with MY money and when can I have it back? Up to 45 day to investigate your own error?

Signed,

Warning::::: DO NOT BANK HERE. I JUST OPENED MY ACCT LESS THAN A WEEK AGO AND CAN ALREADY SAY THIS IS ABSOLUTELY IN BOLD THE WORST BANK EVER!!!!!!! When opening a checking and savings account, I was prompted to deposit $50 into each account with my debit card from my other bank in order to make a deposit. So I used my debit card and deposited $50 into each account-checking and savings. They only put $50 into the checking account and as a result when using my card I went into -$26. I called them at 11 PM to tell them that I could not figure out how to add funds with my debit card to correct the balance and bring it out of the negative and was trying to do so by midnight so I would not receive over withdraw fees. The initial employee I spoke with said I could only add funds at the branch which at that point was closed. They also told me the cut off time for charges was 9pm, not midnight which I have never even heard of before. I explained my concern that I was never informed that using a debit card to add funds was only an option when making an initial deposit and not available in the future. He agreed and stated that it was a “good question,” but said he could not solve my problem and help me fix my balance to prevent any fees, so I asked to speak to a supervisor. Upon speaking to the supervisor -no exaggeration - he would not let me speak and continued to talk over me. When I expressed my feelings in regards to not being informed when signing up that I could not use my debit card in the future to add funds he responded “well it didn’t say you could either, did it?” I was so appalled that it took me a minute to gather my thoughts because I literally thought I was dreaming to be treated like this by not only any employee—but a supervisor. I haven’t even gotten to the worst part.... in response to his rude comment, I asked him if he would please allow me speak and stop speaking over me so I could try to prevent getting charged $216 yes that is correct ($36 per transaction up to 6 transactions a day from what he told me) even though I opted out of being able to over withdraw, and he HUNG UP ON ME!!!!!!!!!!! I am still in disbelief as I type this and I will do every single possible thing regardless if I have to spend every second of my day to make sure that this never happens to anyone else who signs up with this piece of you know what scam artist that they call a “business.” I will report them to the Better Business Bureau, I will plaster it on Facebook, I will plaster it on Twitter, I will plastered on telephone poles if I have to because I am DISGUSTED and because they are simply deserving of it as well as the innocent VICTIMS that they refer to as customers. I hope to God that they record their conversations so that they have it when I take this further. I don’t care if it’s for a penny or a million dollars, NO ONE DESERVES TO BE TREATED LIKE I WAS TONIGHT AND I WILL MAKE SURE NO ONE ELSE EXPERIENCES WHAT I DID. BB&T You should be utterly ashamed of yourself.

Warning::::: DO NOT BANK HERE. I JUST OPENED MY ACCT LESS THAN A WEEK AGO AND CAN ALREADY SAY THIS IS ABSOLUTELY IN BOLD THE WORST BANK EVER!!!!!!! When opening a checking and savings account, I was prompted to deposit $50 into each account with my debit card from my other bank in order to make a deposit. So I used my debit card and deposited $50 into each account-checking and savings. They only put $50 into the checking account and as a result when using my card I went into -$26. I called them at 11 PM to tell them that I could not figure out how to add funds with my debit card to correct the balance and bring it out of the negative and was trying to do so by midnight so I would not receive over withdraw fees. The initial employee I spoke with said I could only add funds at the branch which at that point was closed. They also told me the cut off time for charges was 9pm, not midnight which I have never even heard of before. I explained my concern that I was never informed that using a debit card to add funds was only an option when making an initial deposit and not available in the future. He agreed and stated that it was a “good question,” but said he could not solve my problem and help me fix my balance to prevent any fees, so I asked to speak to a supervisor. Upon speaking to the supervisor -no exaggeration - he would not let me speak and continued to talk over me. When I expressed my feelings in regards to not being informed when signing up that I could not use my debit card in the future to add funds he responded “well it didn’t say you could either, did it?” I was so appalled that it took me a minute to gather my thoughts because I literally thought I was dreaming to be treated like this by not only any employee—but a supervisor. I haven’t even gotten to the worst part.... in response to his rude comment, I asked him if he would please allow me speak and stop speaking over me so I could try to prevent getting charged $216 yes that is correct ($36 per transaction up to 6 transactions a day from what he told me) even though I opted out of being able to over withdraw, and he HUNG UP ON ME!!!!!!!!!!! I am still in disbelief as I type this and I will do every single possible thing regardless if I have to spend every second of my day to make sure that this never happens to anyone else who signs up with this piece of you know what scam artist that they call a “business.” I will report them to the Better Business Bureau, I will plaster it on Facebook, I will plaster it on Twitter, I will plastered on telephone poles if I have to because I am DISGUSTED and because they are simply deserving of it as well as the innocent VICTIMS that they refer to as customers. I hope to God that they record their conversations so that they have it when I take this further. I don’t care if it’s for a penny or a million dollars, NO ONE DESERVES TO BE TREATED LIKE I WAS TONIGHT AND I WILL MAKE SURE NO ONE ELSE EXPERIENCES WHAT I DID. BB&T You should be utterly ashamed of yourself.

As of 2-23-18 9:38AM: Per employee of BB&T that I just spoke with- "BB&T is 100% dead in the water."  No way of checking balances, withdraw funds or confirm that automatic payments have been made or if direct deposits are going through. When I asked if this was cyber related I was told "at this time we don't think so but we also cant rule that out." When I asked can I come down and have all my money removed from the bank they said "no, not at this time." ok....now I'm worried.

I got off with the main branch where I live, and she stated it was a main frame that went down completely. That they have replaced it and fixing to be coming back up shortly. All deposits and things will be coming through in waves today once it’s back up and running. But that deposits will be coming through.

I’m just curious: From what most reports are saying, this is now approaching 20 hours of downtime. It’s been three hours since this update - using the term loosely here - was posted. Some people can use debit cards; others cannot. Some can contact their local branch for assistance; others cannot. Some can get money from a competitor bank’s ATM; others cannot. Yet every person who brings up a valid complaint or concern is met with the same copied and pasted response thanking them for their patience. Regardless of what customers should (or in many financial situations can) do, access to money which is entrusted to BB&T is compromised through no fault of the customers. No actual updates or estimated timelines are being given. There isn’t any transparency. In the time it takes to copy and paste the same response hundreds of times, it seems like SOME update could’ve been prepared to actually (and accurately) put people’s minds at ease. Of course, anyone whose direct deposit is in limbo or whose situation is dire understandably can’t be put at ease until this outage is resolved. Something more than “sorry, we’re fixing it” is needed at this point.

Warning::::: DO NOT BANK HERE. I JUST OPENED MY ACCT LESS THAN A WEEK AGO AND CAN ALREADY SAY THIS IS ABSOLUTELY IN BOLD THE WORST BANK EVER!!!!!!! When opening a checking and savings account, I was prompted to deposit $50 into each account with my debit card from my other bank in order to make a deposit. So I used my debit card and deposited $50 into each account-checking and savings. They only put $50 into the checking account and as a result when using my card I went into -$26. I called them at 11 PM to tell them that I could not figure out how to add funds with my debit card to correct the balance and bring it out of the negative and was trying to do so by midnight so I would not receive over withdraw fees. The initial employee I spoke with said I could only add funds at the branch which at that point was closed. They also told me the cut off time for charges was 9pm, not midnight which I have never even heard of before. I explained my concern that I was never informed that using a debit card to add funds was only an option when making an initial deposit and not available in the future. He agreed and stated that it was a “good question,” but said he could not solve my problem and help me fix my balance to prevent any fees, so I asked to speak to a supervisor. Upon speaking to the supervisor -no exaggeration - he would not let me speak and continued to talk over me. When I expressed my feelings in regards to not being informed when signing up that I could not use my debit card in the future to add funds he responded “well it didn’t say you could either, did it?” I was so appalled that it took me a minute to gather my thoughts because I literally thought I was dreaming to be treated like this by not only any employee—but a supervisor. I haven’t even gotten to the worst part.... in response to his rude comment, I asked him if he would please allow me speak and stop speaking over me so I could try to prevent getting charged $216 yes that is correct ($36 per transaction up to 6 transactions a day from what he told me) even though I opted out of being able to over withdraw, and he HUNG UP ON ME!!!!!!!!!!! I am still in disbelief as I type this and I will do every single possible thing regardless if I have to spend every second of my day to make sure that this never happens to anyone else who signs up with this piece of you know what scam artist that they call a “business.” I will report them to the Better Business Bureau, I will plaster it on Facebook, I will plaster it on Twitter, I will plastered on telephone poles if I have to because I am DISGUSTED and because they are simply deserving of it as well as the innocent VICTIMS that they refer to as customers. I hope to God that they record their conversations so that they have it when I take this further. I don’t care if it’s for a penny or a million dollars, NO ONE DESERVES TO BE TREATED LIKE I WAS TONIGHT AND I WILL MAKE SURE NO ONE ELSE EXPERIENCES WHAT I DID. BB&T You should be utterly ashamed of yourself.

Frustrating and concerning because we received no notification about this problem. You need to send emails to all accounts regarding this serious outage and information on how customers can access their accounts, pay bills online, deposits, etc. No information breeds speculation and speculation causes panic. Warning::::: DO NOT BANK HERE. I JUST OPENED MY ACCT LESS THAN A WEEK AGO AND CAN ALREADY SAY THIS IS ABSOLUTELY IN BOLD THE WORST BANK EVER!!!!!!! When opening a checking and savings account, I was prompted to deposit $50 into each account with my debit card from my other bank in order to make a deposit. So I used my debit card and deposited $50 into each account-checking and savings. They only put $50 into the checking account and as a result when using my card I went into -$26. I called them at 11 PM to tell them that I could not figure out how to add funds with my debit card to correct the balance and bring it out of the negative and was trying to do so by midnight so I would not receive over withdraw fees. The initial employee I spoke with said I could only add funds at the branch which at that point was closed. They also told me the cut off time for charges was 9pm, not midnight which I have never even heard of before. I explained my concern that I was never informed that using a debit card to add funds was only an option when making an initial deposit and not available in the future. He agreed and stated that it was a “good question,” but said he could not solve my problem and help me fix my balance to prevent any fees, so I asked to speak to a supervisor. Upon speaking to the supervisor -no exaggeration - he would not let me speak and continued to talk over me. When I expressed my feelings in regards to not being informed when signing up that I could not use my debit card in the future to add funds he responded “well it didn’t say you could either, did it?” I was so appalled that it took me a minute to gather my thoughts because I literally thought I was dreaming to be treated like this by not only any employee—but a supervisor. I haven’t even gotten to the worst part.... in response to his rude comment, I asked him if he would please allow me speak and stop speaking over me so I could try to prevent getting charged $216 yes that is correct ($36 per transaction up to 6 transactions a day from what he told me) even though I opted out of being able to over withdraw, and he HUNG UP ON ME!!!!!!!!!!! I am still in disbelief as I type this and I will do every single possible thing regardless if I have to spend every second of my day to make sure that this never happens to anyone else who signs up with this piece of you know what scam artist that they call a “business.” I will report them to the Better Business Bureau, I will plaster it on Facebook, I will plaster it on Twitter, I will plastered on telephone poles if I have to because I am DISGUSTED and because they are simply deserving of it as well as the innocent VICTIMS that they refer to as customers. I hope to God that they record their conversations so that they have it when I take this further. I don’t care if it’s for a penny or a million dollars, NO ONE DESERVES TO BE TREATED LIKE I WAS TONIGHT AND I WILL MAKE SURE NO ONE ELSE EXPERIENCES WHAT I DID. BB&T You should be utterly ashamed of yourself.

entered wrong userid / password deliberately, but it's not even doing a user verification, display the same generic page that all services are down. "The service you are attempting to access is currently unavailable. Please try again later. If the problem persists, please call 888-BBT-ONLINE (888-228-6654)."

Website isn't allowing opening of new accounts, "BB&T Online Account Opening is Temporarily Unavailable".  

If it was DDoS attack, we wouldn't even be able to access www.bbt.com without slowness.DDoS makes the whole website slow or inaccessible so you just wait while it looks like the website is loading in your browser. They systems behind the website are definitely down.  Any online company has redundant measures so if one component goes down, another takes over or issues with configs, networks can be fixed fairly quickly. Even a part of a redundant data center being burned down doesn't cause this much chaos.  

I'm almost certain they are compromised. Remember Sony? It took them a while to admit they were hacked and even then, they didn't know the extent. The CISO and BBT management are probably up and meeting to determine how to relay the info to customers before banks open.

Warning::::: DO NOT BANK HERE. I JUST OPENED MY ACCT LESS THAN A WEEK AGO AND CAN ALREADY SAY THIS IS ABSOLUTELY IN BOLD THE WORST BANK EVER!!!!!!! When opening a checking and savings account, I was prompted to deposit $50 into each account with my debit card from my other bank in order to make a deposit. So I used my debit card and deposited $50 into each account-checking and savings. They only put $50 into the checking account and as a result when using my card I went into -$26. I called them at 11 PM to tell them that I could not figure out how to add funds with my debit card to correct the balance and bring it out of the negative and was trying to do so by midnight so I would not receive over withdraw fees. The initial employee I spoke with said I could only add funds at the branch which at that point was closed. They also told me the cut off time for charges was 9pm, not midnight which I have never even heard of before. I explained my concern that I was never informed that using a debit card to add funds was only an option when making an initial deposit and not available in the future. He agreed and stated that it was a “good question,” but said he could not solve my problem and help me fix my balance to prevent any fees, so I asked to speak to a supervisor. Upon speaking to the supervisor -no exaggeration - he would not let me speak and continued to talk over me. When I expressed my feelings in regards to not being informed when signing up that I could not use my debit card in the future to add funds he responded “well it didn’t say you could either, did it?” I was so appalled that it took me a minute to gather my thoughts because I literally thought I was dreaming to be treated like this by not only any employee—but a supervisor. I haven’t even gotten to the worst part.... in response to his rude comment, I asked him if he would please allow me speak and stop speaking over me so I could try to prevent getting charged $216 yes that is correct ($36 per transaction up to 6 transactions a day from what he told me) even though I opted out of being able to over withdraw, and he HUNG UP ON ME!!!!!!!!!!! I am still in disbelief as I type this and I will do every single possible thing regardless if I have to spend every second of my day to make sure that this never happens to anyone else who signs up with this piece of you know what scam artist that they call a “business.” I will report them to the Better Business Bureau, I will plaster it on Facebook, I will plaster it on Twitter, I will plastered on telephone poles if I have to because I am DISGUSTED and because they are simply deserving of it as well as the innocent VICTIMS that they refer to as customers. I hope to God that they record their conversations so that they have it when I take this further. I don’t care if it’s for a penny or a million dollars, NO ONE DESERVES TO BE TREATED LIKE I WAS TONIGHT AND I WILL MAKE SURE NO ONE ELSE EXPERIENCES WHAT I DID. BB&T You should be utterly ashamed of yourself.

When opening a checking and savings account, I was prompted to deposit $50 into each account with my debit card from my other bank in order to make a deposit. So I used my debit card and deposited $50 into each account-checking and savings. They only put $50 into the checking account and as a result when using my card I went into -$26. I called them at 11 PM to tell them that I could not figure out how to add funds with my debit card to correct the balance and bring it out of the negative and was trying to do so by midnight so I would not receive over withdraw fees. They also told me the cut off time for charges was 9pm, not midnight which I have never even heard of before. I explained my concern that I was never informed that using a debit card to add funds was only an option when making an initial deposit and not available in the future. He agreed and stated that it was a “good question,” but said he could not solve my problem and help me fix my balance to prevent any fees, so I asked to speak to a supervisor. Upon speaking to the supervisor -no exaggeration - he would not let me speak and continued to talk over me. When I expressed my feelings in regards to not being informed when signing up that I could not use my debit card in the future to add funds he responded “well it didn’t say you could either, did it?” I was so appalled that it took me a minute to gather my thoughts because I literally thought I was dreaming to be treated like this by not only any employee—but a supervisor.
