While it's unfortunate that the systems are down, I'm seeing people say that this is a result of a DDoS attack. Lol where did you get that from and based on what evidence? A DDoS is not a "hack" and no threat actor or "hacker" can gain access to a website or it's resources through a DDoS attack. A DDoS attack causes a web server to become overloaded with connection requests until it crashes (go offline). If that was the case, you couldn't even resolve DNS to BBT.com or access the website as you would get a page can't be displayed. Since the website is up, despite the apology message, it's not a DDoS attack or hack as some have put it. Furthermore, all banks, not just BBT, PNC, Wells Fargo, etc, have to follow federal regulations and guidelines before releasing internal or sensitive information to the public or subjected to multiple violations and can even be shutdown if not handled property.
I used to work in the financial industry and you'll be surprised how quick people are walked out the door for not abiding by federal regulations. While this is unfortunate and its a very bad inconvenience, for it to be this wide spread, it sounds like a server or hardware failure. Whatever it is, I'm hoping it gets fixed soon. While it's frustrating, just remember that this can happen to ANY bank or credit union. None of them are immune to these type of issues.

Warning::::: DO NOT BANK HERE. I JUST OPENED MY ACCT LESS THAN A WEEK AGO AND CAN ALREADY SAY THIS IS ABSOLUTELY IN BOLD THE WORST BANK EVER!!!!!!! When opening a checking and savings account, I was prompted to deposit $50 into each account with my debit card from my other bank in order to make a deposit. So I used my debit card and deposited $50 into each account-checking and savings. They only put $50 into the checking account and as a result when using my card I went into -$26. I called them at 11 PM to tell them that I could not figure out how to add funds with my debit card to correct the balance and bring it out of the negative and was trying to do so by midnight so I would not receive over withdraw fees. The initial employee I spoke with said I could only add funds at the branch which at that point was closed. They also told me the cut off time for charges was 9pm, not midnight which I have never even heard of before. I explained my concern that I was never informed that using a debit card to add funds was only an option when making an initial deposit and not available in the future. He agreed and stated that it was a “good question,” but said he could not solve my problem and help me fix my balance to prevent any fees, so I asked to speak to a supervisor. Upon speaking to the supervisor -no exaggeration - he would not let me speak and continued to talk over me. When I expressed my feelings in regards to not being informed when signing up that I could not use my debit card in the future to add funds he responded “well it didn’t say you could either, did it?” I was so appalled that it took me a minute to gather my thoughts because I literally thought I was dreaming to be treated like this by not only any employee—but a supervisor. I haven’t even gotten to the worst part.... in response to his rude comment, I asked him if he would please allow me speak and stop speaking over me so I could try to prevent getting charged $216 yes that is correct ($36 per transaction up to 6 transactions a day from what he told me) even though I opted out of being able to over withdraw, and he HUNG UP ON ME!!!!!!!!!!! I am still in disbelief as I type this and I will do every single possible thing regardless if I have to spend every second of my day to make sure that this never happens to anyone else who signs up with this piece of you know what scam artist that they call a “business.” I will report them to the Better Business Bureau, I will plaster it on Facebook, I will plaster it on Twitter, I will plastered on telephone poles if I have to because I am DISGUSTED and because they are simply deserving of it as well as the innocent VICTIMS that they refer to as customers. I hope to God that they record their conversations so that they have it when I take this further. I don’t care if it’s for a penny or a million dollars, NO ONE DESERVES TO BE TREATED LIKE I WAS TONIGHT AND I WILL MAKE SURE NO ONE ELSE EXPERIENCES WHAT I DID. BB&T You should be utterly ashamed of yourself.

Our mortgage experience has been nothing but inefficient and infuriating with BB&T. At this point, I wouldn't recommend considering this lender for a loan at all. 
Yesterday, we signed our closing documents and paid. We should be walking into our house right now, but instead we are waiting for BB&T to correct a mistake on their end so they will send the funds to complete the transaction. We have provided everything they need throughout this process promptly - generally within a couple hours.
Our mortgage counselor was rarely there, and we were fobbed off on other people. He mislabeled our mortgage and caused a lot of confusion. At one point we thought things were back on track, only to find out from the title company that they repeatedly sent documents that were wrong - including getting my name completely wrong. 
And now, a temp is working on our loan. A temp. And that temp can't figure out what the hold up is. 

Run from this company. I held off writing this review because I thought things were back on track, it seems they're determined to be unprofessional and inefficient until the bitter end.

Terrible customer service. I reported fraud activity on my account the same day I saw unauthorized transactions. I called the fraud division, they first told me to wait the transactions to be posted to my account (instead of reversing the pending transaction I reported the same day). I called again after the transactions were posted, they gave a claim number and told me they would send some forms to my mailing address (which were supposed to arrive within the next 10 business days), that was Dec 01. Today I called again as the forms didn't arrive, they said my claim was denied.... what can I expect if even before submitting the forms they say my claim has been denied... I am also being charged the maintenance fee as my average balance was affected with the purchases.... They told me I should send proof of the irregular activity to a fax number, I sent proof of the police report, letters to the bank, proof of E-mails I sent to report irregular activity the very same day the operations were made...
If you are asking me for proof that there was fraud, then I should also ask the bank to present proof on how my debit card was activated if I didn't activated through phone or online (as they said I should do). 

Very frustrating experience, specially because I am not in the US and I've tried my best, called to the branch, fraud division,  sent e-mails, sent proofs to get my money back, but the bank will make it as hard as possible to study the claim... Not happy with BB&T

BB&T changed my account name without my consent. BB&T added a "bbt" in front of my account and did not disclose the change. After 15 minutes of arguing, the call center representative admits the mistake on BB&T's side, and asks me to wait for it to be changed back. This takes another 15 minutes. Finally when it was changed back, I attempted to log in. But this time, the password had been changed, but the new password was not provided to me. Making the entire effort useless. Finally, after asking to speak to a manager, the password was reset once more and provided to me. This was only after I had requested numerous times since I could not even log onto my account. The manager was unapologetic, and seemed aloof to the situation. Only when asked for an apology, he reluctantly apologized, stating that he apologized previously (which he didn't). To make matters worse, I disclosed before the conversation with the manager that I am recording the conversation. My entire savings is in this account, so I thought I might need evidence if things go awry. The call center is located in North Carolina, and I am calling from Virginia -- both states which have "one-party consent law". The manager is ignorant to this fact, and refuses to speak with me without my turning the recording off. I do it so that I can get my account unlocked. This was an overall frustrating experience, as I wasted close to 2 hours to resolve this matter. None of the representatives gave me the feeling that they genuinely wanted to help. One even went as far to accuse me that I changed my ID and forgotten myself (who later admitted to the mistake -- but did not apologize). I created my first bank account with BB&T, and wanted to stay loyal since they used to have excellent customer service. But it is obvious this is no longer the case. I will be withdrawing the entirety of my savings and transferring to another bank who deserve my business.

The policies have changed from a benefit to a hassle banking with BB&T.
I have been using bill pay for a couple years now.
I have been able to schedule payments regardless of my actual account balance.
Recently ran into this problem:
Checking account has direct deposit with paydays twice a month on Fridays.
I scheduled 4 bill pays on Nov 30th to be paid on DEC 4th.
Money was in my account by the first.
I knew trying to schedule a payment the same day as a direct deposit probably wouldn’t work.
To my surprise on the 5th I got a notice telling me my payments failed due to insufficient  funds.
How?
A call to customer service revealed that in order for a payment to be paid. funds must be availble in your account 2 days prior to a scheduled bill pay.
I also received a terse warning that overdraft fees my assessed if it happens again [ note that would have been 4 overdrafts at $35 a piece ]
So now ive been scolded, late fees from service providers and left scratching my head.
Plus any scheduled payment "locks" the funds for 48 hours prior to the actual payment with no way to cancel the payment.

How is this more convenient for the customer?
I can walk into Walmart and pay these bills the same day for a very small fee with no hassles.
i could write a check or send a money order versus going thru hoops of fire just to pay a bill,very inconvenient.
and the complaints never stop. These banksters are tyrants and should be shut down for bank fraud and conspiracy.

Are you serious? I'm warning all my friends not to get an account at BBT if they live check to check. The bill pay doesn't work for you. It is insane that you cannot pick the send date for your bills LOL. Seriously? They did show me some enormously complicated time-consuming way that I can do some math within each bill to try to figure out when it would come out lol. Since we have a small business and pay 50 bills every two weeks or so I do not have an extra 5 hours to do this and then not even be sure that it's going to come out on pay day. Our bills have to come out on our pay days. Not on a delivery date or something. If we use delivery date there's a chance our bills will come out the day before our payday and then we'll get massive fees. Is that why they changed it to this way that you can't control your financing? We have had BB&T multiple accounts for over 10 years and because of this I'm going to have to change to any other local bank because any one of them lets you pay your bills on your payday. That is why I have a bank so that I can pay bills. So without access to a real bill pay that I can control the day it goes out it's useless to us. I'm so upset that we now have to start over with a new bank because you want us to pick a delivery date and have no real control over our finances and bills. I could not believe what I was seeing. I immediately went in and deleted all the future bills that I had scheduled. Typically I get a bill and I type it into bill pay for the Payday for which it is due. That keeps everything straight and I never miss a bill. No possible way to do that anymore. I mean it is really beyond belief that you would change the bill pay from date being sent to a delivery date system. Only people with a lot of money that don't live check to check will be able to use your new system. I expect you're probably going to lose a lot of people.

An inspiring story.  I am a 19 year breast cancer survivor.  I am a former 39 year BB&T employee. I met you once at our regional meeting in Roanoke, VA.  I wish you the best in your journey. God bless you and your family.

You are truly an inspiration! I am a BB&T employee of 18 years and recently celebrated being a 10 year breast cancer survivor. My co-workers (which I also call my family) have been so supportive. Blessed to also work for a company with great benefits. Keep up the fight!
Thank you for sharing your journey with us.  You inspire us every day in so many ways.  We are so blessed to work for such a wonderful company. Prayers for a speedy and full recovery.

I am proud and oh so thankful to work for this amazingly grounded company in a team under Barbara's leadership.  Shortly after joining BB&T my husband was diagnosed with cancer.  The support, understanding, love, and encouragement given to us from the good people of this company throughout our two year journey meant so much to the both of us.  Because I worked for a company that allowed flexibility during this time, we were able to make the most of the time he had left and take care of what was necessary.  When he passed away last year, the support did not end.  Barbara, thank you for having the courage to share with the world such meaningful words.  I truly understand the emotional and physical challenges you and your family face each day.  Much love to you and yours.

Barbara, I am an 8 year breast cancer survivor and have been with BB&T for 32 years.  I had just recently had a mammogram as well and 4 months later found mine through a self examination. Kick it's behind!!  I stress to all to conduct your self exams.

Barbara so many are touched by you sharing your story!!! You are such an inspiration to so many women within the BB&T family. Your leadership, your smile, your positive energy, and most of all your faith has and will take you far!!! We are all rooting for you!!! Prayers!!!

Barbara, I am a five year triple negative survivor.  You are an inspiration to everyone. My faith has carried me every step of the way and so will yours. God Bless you and keep you safe as you share this journey.

BB&T - I would love to speak with your Regional President in the Raleigh market about sponsoring the charity gala I am planning for April 7, 2018 at the North Raleigh Hilton (www.trianglemets.org), with 100% of proceeds going to METAvivor. METAvivor (www.metavivor.org) is the only 501c3 non profit in the United States that gives 100% of donations to stage IV metastatic breast cancer research! I am 38 years old and have a 5 year old son, and have been fighting Stage IV metastatic breast cancer for 2 years. Thanks so much!!

Thank you for sharing your story ,I too am a survivor of this awful thing called CANCER .I had a double mastectomy recently ,this is not a easy road we travel .It's like a roller coaster ride ,up & down days .I don't think we really know what lays ahead for anyone on this journey but I also know with each step we take & those steps add up to another day makes us say "Thank You to The One Above"I never have felt sorry for myself but sure have had my days of being scared,I also have a great support system with family & friends.I also try to let others know what they might encounter with changes in their lives.Bless you in your journey

Thank you for sharing your story Barbara!  Since joining the company almost 18 years ago working for you, I have respected and admired your leadership style and genuine concern and focus on your associates.  I know your strength and faith in God will allow you to beat this disease!  Praying for you and your family!

Barbara, as a retiree after a wonderful 30 year career with BB&T, you have always been the example of what a great leader should be. You are in my thoughts and prayers.  Julian

Barbara ur story is much like mine in some ways. I worked for BB&T for 15 years. While at BB&T I was diagnosed with (3 negative ) breast cancer in 2005. My mother died at 31 from BC.  I inherited the BC gene. I also continued to work while going through Chemo. My clients and co-workers were awesome. My prayers are with u. I’m  still here 12 years later. I left banking in 2015 and am now a business high school teacher at Douglas Byrd High School in Fayetteville NC. I would love to have u as a guest speaker in my class. Stay strong!  Chemo warriors stick together!!!!

Your story is so inspiring for others who are fighting the fight. I am a six year Breast cancer survivor. Your story hits close to my heart.  I do not recognize you but there was a Duck family in Churchland area of Portsmouth VA. We all went to school with. I wondered if that is you. Anyway prayers for a continued recovery. Yes it does get easier but at check up time the worries come back.  Take care <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B2><U+0095>

I am a 15 year overcomer of this horrid disease; a BB&T customer for life; and a prayer warrior for brave folks like Barbara. Thank you for sharing.

A brief story about BBT and their TRICKY and THUGGISH PRACTICES!
Have had mortgage with Susquehanna for years -long before the dreaded BBT Takeover came marching into town. In short order was appalled by the BBT attitude and practices and moved to another bank.
Deposit just enough month monthly in BBT to cover the automatic debiting of account for mortgage-and as such maintain a very small balance in BBT checking.
Got a notice today 9/23 via postcard that on 9/5 a charge of $50 was presented to make a payment-inadvertently done by me (hit the wrong key thinking payment was to come out of my "Real Bank Account" which created a $27 overdraft. BBT was
"delighted " to pay the $50 and charge me $36 Overdraft.
No notification til 9/23 And $8 per day additional overdraft charge!
Just happened to review my account today and discovered this mess which in the day of Susquehanna (or Minotola Bank) would have been resolved with a quick call or email from local branch and we would have made right.
This is the nature of BBT-screw the customer as often and as deeply as possible,. This is no exception-this is the rule!
BBT-Bad Banking Today

Dear Mr. Darryl McMillan/ BB&T SW Florida regional Manager:

(239-938-7343)

I received your name and contact information yesterday from Mr. David Antonucci, at the BB&T Vanderbilt Branch. I asked for your information because I have been having a lot of problems with my local BB&T Branch located at 27801 Old 41 Road, in Bonita Springs.

After numerous requests to Mr. Justin Riccio both by my wife, Yumiko and I, verbally, and by email, we finally received the paperwork on my daughter’s Toyota Camry loan that we refinanced from PNC Bank. Is it normal operating procedure to take over two months and countless requests to process a refinanced car loan and also receive a copy of a car loan agreement from BB&T?

In addition, yesterday afternoon we were shocked to find out that there is still an outstanding payment of around $300 owed to PNC, plus the title is still in the possession of PNC Bank. Also, we still haven't received our Sienna car loan paperwork. Is it standard Banking Protocol to not give a copy of the car loan contracts to the customer?

I was informed by Mr. Thomas Drake, who is the Financial Advisor at PNC Bonita Beach Branch that our loan account (00003302008127077186) has an outstanding payment of $295.85, which was due on September 5th.

In addition to questioning why I had to write Mr. Riccio a check for $290 to cover the additional charges for the loan, we would like to know how something like this can happen and how the previous 2 to 3 months in late payments are going to affect my credit rating.

At your earliest convenience, I would greatly appreciate you calling me at either our home or at my ABC Fine Wines & Spirits Store so we can hopefully shed some light on this car loan problem and amicably resolve this issue.

Thank you in advance for your kind attention to this matter!

With Together in Purpose regards,

Stephen & Yumiko Simms

Last month I paid, as normal on the 5th and several days later I receive an email that my payment was declined. THE MONEY WAS IN MY ACCOUNT. Instead of fighting with the lender I reissued the payment with the $200 fee. I have been speaking with BB&T and they know the money was there but they refuse to refund my $200 that I had to pay. I keep getting the put in rotation and round and round in circles! I am very upset and can not believe that a fee I had to pay due to the bank being at fault has not been returned! I will be closing my account!

They're always sneaking & finding ways 2 take money from ppl, in my opinion. A few days ago, they paid the same exact bill TWICE! She pays this same bill ONCE a month, every month for awhile now. She has the money in her account to cover the one bill correctly. But since they charged her twice for same bill, it caused her to be overdrawn. So then they charge a $36 overdraft fee, for something that is not her fault. Rightfully, the extra, 2nd bill that was paid got credited back to her. But she never got the $36 overdraft fee back! She ultimately had to pay $36 to BB&T for something that was not her fault. They are beating around the bush & blaming the company that collects the bill every month, even though this company didnt keep this $36! Ahhhh BB&T.  I came to the bank as part of an acquisition of a smaller local bank. You know, the kind that knows you, offers great personal service, etc.  I live in the Harrisburg, Pa region and words cannot express the absolutely horrific service I have received. From the downtown branch to the local management to the regional manager, the "big bank" mentality rules. Forget about making a personal connection. The Gettysburg Road branch is tops, but downtown and St. John's Church road are terrible. Incompetent tellers, mis posted payments, etc. Ya can't get a call back to answer a question, but if North Carolina  wants to get a hold of you to tell you you are 3 days late on a payment every phone you have blows up more than 5 times a day.  This institution was greater for, and streamlined to, make money for its shareholders, while leaving the little guy in its wake. Stay as far as you can from this bank. PM me if you'd like more specifics. I'm no longer a customer of the bank, after a 10 year relationship. Too bad, just a Lil customer service and responsiveness would have made all the difference in the world. Congrats on your profits!!!

I had the worst experience at BB&T yesterday! I tried to send a wire & the lady helping me transposed a few numbers so it was sent to the wrong account. No biggie right, I should have double checked the number. However i went to a branch to try to get the wire corrected & it was torture! The teller helping me was in hold with her own wire department for around 15mins before anyone answered, then the info they gave her was inadequate. I left that branch & drove to the branch that I sent the wire from and the young lady their only got on the phone to track down my money because I sat in her office until I had answers. I'm pretty bank savvy so I knew that if I didn't have answers before 2pm there was a chance I'd have to wait until the next day to get the money. Needless, I was told I'd have to wait until the next business day. I pulled the rest of my savings & took it to another bank that day. At no point in time did ANYONE in either of these banks make me feel like this was important to them. In fact when I complained to a branch manager he explained that none of their employees knew much about wire transfers. Unbelievable to me. My response then they should have made it a point to ask enough questions to understand how they work.  I was stunned by the lack of initiative both employees displayed when in the phone with the wire department.
The money is now back in my soon to be closed account but, of course, a $30 wiring fee has been deducted from my account. Unbelievably lacking in knowledge and service.

You know, the kind that knows you, offers great personal service, etc.  I live in the Harrisburg, Pa region and words cannot express the absolutely horrific service I have received. From the downtown branch to the local management to the regional manager, the "big bank" mentality rules. Forget about making a personal connection. The Gettysburg Road branch is tops, but downtown and St. John's Church road are terrible. Incompetent tellers, mis posted payments, etc. Ya can't get a call back to answer a question, but if North Carolina  wants to get a hold of you to tell you you are 3 days late on a payment every phone you have blows up more than 5 times a day.  This institution was greater for, and streamlined to, make money for its shareholders, while leaving the little guy in its wake. Stay as far as you can from this bank. PM me if you'd like more specifics. I'm no longer a customer of the bank, after a 10 year relationship. Too bad, just a Lil customer service and responsiveness would have made all the difference in the world. Congrats on your profits!!!

I have nothing but great service with BB&T. I live in Inverness FL and whenever my husband and I have a problem we can go there or call and get help immediately. I had another that treated me like trash and I did take all my funds out. BB&T IS THE BEST.

Here is a good one, when you make a purchase with your debit card, that money is put on hold from your account and no longer available for use, if you have any hard charges come in you will receive overdraft fees even if the pending charges have not posted yet, fair enough, but then when the pending charges come in, you know the ones that caused you to overdraft because the money was put on hold, you get overdraft charges again because after they charged you overdraft fees because they paid the hard charges with the money they put on hold to pay the pending charges. So you get charged overdraft fees twice when your account would have covered either set of charges.

Here is a good one, when you make a purchase with your debit card, that money is put on hold from your account and no longer available for use, if you have any hard charges come in you will receive overdraft fees even if the pending charges have not posted yet, fair enough, but then when the pending charges come in, you know the ones that caused you to overdraft because the money was put on hold, you get overdraft charges again because after they charged you overdraft fees because they paid the hard charges with the money they put on hold to pay the pending charges. So you get charged overdraft fees twice when your account would have covered either set of charges

Personal experience.  This bank failed to self report elder financial abuse to proper agencies. They declared it and said call police.  Called it elder abuse.  Fast forward the abuser of this military widow has been arrested, spent night in jail, then indicted by a grand jury in NC recently.  Appeared in Superior Court on Jan. 10 of this year.   Flaming abuse but NC bank had to look the other way.  HORRIBLE. That is what the Commonwealth Attorney called it in county I live in.  I am a victim.  Assigned to a Victims Assistance program and an advocate.  Moved from a lower court to Superior when DA saw the evidence.  Bank records.  Class F felony.  Highest felony for embezzlement in NC.  Explotiation of elder or disabled person.  Shame on the bank for not using their own red flag alerts.  Shame.  Case is at state level now but my widows funds were all federal.  They are very interested in this situation.  Justice Dept.  Has been notified as have every federal agency involved.  VA, IRS, AND FEDERAL PENSION AKA CIVIL SERVICE.  Shame on choice to look the other way and allow looting of 2 accounts.  Death of a 100 per cent combat wounded Vietnam Vet and his determined effort to work after recovering, if u ever from losing a left leg and arm in that horrible war. Retired from IRS after 30 years, military time included, as a Grade 13 Revenue Officer.  What she looted was from his hard work.  Stopping bank statements was a big red flag.  Died from a fall resulting in a deadly brain bleed in Durham, VA. A soldier to the end.  My sister's email to the Governor of VA got the ball rolling and case went to state it belonged in, NC.  Governor's office responded next day to email.  Unlike the bank they did not look away. Moving from my home because of this financial disaster.  Thank you BBT and that angel faced criminal.

My father died at Christmas leaving his checking account to me and my 2 siblings by designating us as equal beneficiaries using a Pay On Death instruction.  We all live in different states.  It has been a nightmare dealing with this bank.  Today, my sister, the executor for my father's estate, went to the Sylva NC branch to close the account.  She had in her possession a certified death certificate.  The bank issued a cashier's check to her in all 3 of our names.  THE CHECK IS USELESS!!!  We live in 3 different states, can't get together to sign this useless check so that it can be cashed and the funds disbursed as per my father's POD.  AND SHE WAS TOLD SHE COULD NOT RETURN TO THAT BANK BRANCH TO CASH IT EVEN IF SHE COULD MANAGE TO GET OUR SIGNATURES ON THE CHECK.  So, BB&T, you are still holding our money hostage!  The account has been closed and we have a useless cashier's check that NO BANK will cash.  Now we have to hire an attorney to sue your bank to get our money.  Is this how you treat your customers?  Even though your "customer" is deceased, we became your customer's at the time of my father's death.  What is so hard about closing an account and issuing separate checks to the 3 names beneficiaries?  I'll probably not hear anything from you in reply to this post.  You didn't reply to my first post yesterday either.  But I will continue to post my complaints until this gets resolved.  You do not do business in an honorable way and I am glad that I do not bank with you.

Capitalistic Economic Thoughts emerged from Catholic economic institutions based on private property, quasi-freedom rights, monopolistic inheritance laws, oligopolistic markets and state taxes; Socialistic Economic Thoughts emerged from rebellion against the curse of Roman-Catholic Feudal-Capitalist economic institutions and based on public property, public policy and monopoly authority; Market Economic Thoughts are based on private property, existing institutions, freedom rights, free markets, state taxes and prevailing institutions; and Democratic Economic Thoughts are based on democratic (freedom and equal/equitable) rights, private property, democratic inheritance laws, democratic SAI institution, democratic  public policy, competitive markets and state taxes.

 We shall Congratulate Donald Trump as 45th US President; and advise him that US severely needs more Democratic Economic Institutions for democratic economy, higher growth, increasing employment and equitable income distribution. Let's start—
xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

Capital is not only a factor of production, but also the prime factor for income distribution as well as for the nature of economic system and political economy. Therefore, “Capital Distribution” is more crucial than “Income Distribution” in Economics. 

The FUNDAMENTAL LIMITATIION of Conventional Economics is that it has many theories of income distribution, but has no any theory on capital distribution. The income distribution theories are less capable to explain and solve the emerging democratic economic system and democratic political economy. 

Still today, the inheritance statutes of various religions are used in transferring and distributing property/capital over generations. Those statutes had/have generated capitalistic/oligopolistic, quasi-democratic and democratic economic systems and political economies accordingly. 

As they were based on the monopoly inheritance institution of Roman-Catholic, the ancient West European societies or states successively evolved into the social systems of Slavism, Feudalism and Capitalism with the development of technology. While the democratic inheritance institution of Cristian-Muslim generates democratic economic systems and political economies accordingly. 

Religious inheritance statutes of property/capital are deductive, dogmatic and unauthorized to change. While scientific inheritance laws of property/capital are inductive, imperial and causal as well as changeable to necessity of time as the emerging economic systems and political economies is changing. 

The Nobel Economist Joseph Stiglitz and the French Economist Thomas Piketty have unveiled that capital grows faster over income and creates additional income inequalities. If a democratic (equal/equitable) capital distribution is ensured, both capital and income would grow consistently; and many crises of growth and distribution as well as economic system and political economy can be solved. 

======================================== 
* Mohammad Ahsanul Karim is founder of the School of Democratic Political Economics. He is conceptual initiator of incomplete basic democratic structural and institutional reforms in Bangladesh since 1982. He is author of the books, Progressive Democracy (1991) and Points of Constitution Amendment (2011) and few articles on democratic reforms.  

For your critical review------ Four School of Fundamental Economic Thoughts: An analysis of Institutional Differences
===========================================

http://www.bostonbanglanews.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=45835

For your critical review------ Christian-Muslims and US Democracy
============================== 

http://bostonbanglanews.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=42919:christian-muslims-and-us-democracy--mohammad-ahsanul-karim&catid=87:lekhokderkolam&Itemid=162

I volunteer for the Salvation Army in the food pantry for 1/2 day per week. I help prepare food boxes for needy individuals and families.  I volunteer at Hope Lodge.  I help at the front desk.  I am a member of the Service League of Greenville.  I volunteer in the gift shop.   We use our profits to help the hospital through the Vidant Foundation.  Currently we are planning to fund the healing garden of the new cancer center .  I am Membership Chair at Congregation Bayt Shalom. BB&T, if I were to win, I would immediately donate 100% to our nonprofit ministry 'Helping The Homeless' we are we feed clover and hope to be able to provide shelter to the homeless. Currently we have a commercial food bus when we bring food prepared by Chef and take it to the homeless living in the woods and on the streets we also response and natural disasters locally and regionally. In addition we have a storehouse facility that operates year around where we accept donations of household goods such as furniture, dishes, and clothing especially winter wear socks and blankets that are distributed to families in need and also two families and individuals living on the streets. We recently had Land donated to us, and We envision a center coming in the near future called 'Camp Restoration' where struggling families will have a place to regroup get back on their feet be loved and discipled with strategies to help build a solid foundation financially learn jobs training skills and then help find a place to live occupation and transportation to be successful when they leave one year later.  Please consider me, because it's not for me, but for 'us'.  www.facebook.com/dbahelpingthehomeless

This isn't a bitter post, it's simply candid feedback. I've never switched banks in my 30 years of banking because of a poor opinion of a bank. That changed last week, however. I've been banking with a local bank up until last year when my bank was purchased by BB&T. I wasn't thrilled, but vowed to give BB&T a shot. Well, BB&T had a shot, and baby it ain't workin' out. The final straw was learning I was on the hook to purchase new checks for my checking account. Now matter who I talked to, there was not even a hint of budging. That fried my shorts because I didn't have a say in being bought out. Sorry, that's not my cost. BB&T essentially lost my four accounts over $25. Net profit for Q3 was $599,000,000 and you can't even buy checks in a situation like this. Shameful. When I cleaned out my accounts and walked into my new bank, the contrast was unmistakable. People these days talk a lot about the culture of a business. My, my....the contrast. Walk into BB&T: no one looks up. Mechanical. Policy driven. I was surprised the lady didn't even ask me why I was closing my accounts. (I'm assuming it's such a common experience, they don't even ask anymore) Walk into my new LOCAL bank: greeted with a smile. Felt like a valued PERSON. Felt like they wanted my business. Had a chance to chat with the branch manager and he's reporting a steady stream of BB&T customers walking in his door. Wonder why. (By the way, he also read over BB&T literature and said the thing about forcing the customers to buy new checks puzzled him as well. It's no wonder the name BB&Fee is catching on) Anyway, just thought in some small way somewhere this review may help in improvement. Ya'll, it's about the PEOPLE. A healthy bank is one that handles money well and handles people well. My experience is that BB&T needs to work on the latter.

The service rendered to myself on today was piss poor. If you are in the profession of business dealing with other people's money, you should wear a smile to work daily with an earnest heart to help others; after all, it is their money that keeps you employed.
Today, I closed my account with BB&T due to repeated misconduct. Several weeks ago, I was denied access to my own funds with my debit card at hand. The banker, Mr. Eduardo Matiz, took one look at me and decided to make things difficult. I had never before seen him, and neither did he recognize me.
Therefore, I was instructed (not advised) to return with an ID. I opted to standby in the lobby until another banker would kindly assist me. Although my license was expired, I had a good rapport with the other bankers. His decision to be resistant with me was apparent.

One week ago, after returning from the hurricane evacuation, I visited the branch to deposit a money order into my account. The money order had already been addressed to my apartments, but was not endorsed. I had two options: return the money order to Western Union or deposit it into my checking account.
Guess what happen, the banker would not allow me to deposit it although the money order had the original receipt attached. She directed me to Western Union for a refund and pointed away to leave the counter. Who wants to deal with people like this when you're handling the money you worked hard for? I asked her for her card, she did not have one to offer. Then she scribbled her name on a sheet of loose paper.
There is so much more to write about this experience. I do not function to destroy others, but only to build. I rather keep my money than to encounter people with conflicted prejudices.

My fiancée just received her disability and that means a check on the first payment. Well, we went to another bank to try and cash it and they flat out refused since we aren't account holders so then I went to the BB&T branch here. I had multiple accounts prior to becoming disabled and I knew the folks would do everything they could with "no" only coming if a solution couldn't be found. Long story short they cashed the check and charged a very minimal fee to do so. We're still in the process of getting things back in order, but I won't forget how I was treated yesterday and when I'm in a position to have an account again it will be at BB&T. You folks have always treated me like a millionaire even though I'm not and I want folks to know that. If you want excellent service you want BB&T

BB&T has/is not applying our additional payments to the principal of our mortgage. BB&T have hidden the additional payments in a suspense account that we cannot access. BB&T has adjusted our account to be paid ahead instead in principal pay-down. This has all been done without my knowledge and is set up in order for more compound interest to accrue You are in violation of the Dodd Frank Laws. Our account needs to be looked at and previous payments applied arrears/retroactively. KELLY S. KING you are the CEO do you know what your bank is doing!
Dodd Frank Laws
NO RUNAROUNDS
When mortgage servicers make mistakes, records get lost, payments are processed too slowly, or
servicer personnel do not have the latest information about a consumer’s account, the consumer suffers
the consequences. CFPB’s rules require common-sense policies and procedures for handling consumer
accounts and preventing runarounds. These rules include:
5
Payments Promptly Credited: Servicers must credit a borrower’s account the date the payment is
received. Specifically:
• If the servicer receives a payment covering principal, interest, and any required escrow amount, the
payment must be credited the date received, even if the payment does not cover any outstanding
fees;
• If the servicer places partial payments in a “suspense account,” once the amount in such an account
equals a full payment, the servicer must credit it to the borrower’s account.
Prompt Response to Requests for Balances: Servicers must generally provide a response to consumer
requests for the balance of their mortgage loans within seven business days of receiving a written
request.
Errors Corrected and Information Provided Quickly: Servicers must acknowledge and respond to
written notices from consumers with respect to certain errors or requesting information regarding their
mortgage loan accounts. Specifically:
• Servicers must respond to notification of errors or information requests submitted in writing;
• Servicers must generally acknowledge the notification of an error or a request for information
within five days; and
• Generally, within 30-45 days of receiving a notice of error or information request, servicers must:
o Correct the error and notify the borrower of the correction or provide the information
requested;
o Conduct an investigation and notify the borrower that no error has occurred; or
o Notify the borrower that the information requested is not available.
• Many errors fall under the error resolution requirements, including:
o Incorrect calculations of credits or payments;
o Incorrect payments (or non-payments) of taxes and insurance from escrow accounts;
o Inaccurate information about how a borrower can avoid foreclosure; and
o Any other error relating to the servicing of the borrower’s mortgage loan

BB&T has/is not applying our additional payments to the principal of our mortgage. BB&T have hidden the additional payments in a suspense account that we cannot access. BB&T has adjusted our account to be paid ahead instead in principal pay-down. This has all been done without my knowledge and is set up in order for more compound interest to accrue You are in violation of the Dodd Frank Laws. Our account needs to be looked at and previous payments applied arrears/retroactively. KELLY S. KING you are the CEO do you know what your bank is doing!
Dodd Frank Laws
NO RUNAROUNDS
When mortgage servicers make mistakes, records get lost, payments are processed too slowly, or
servicer personnel do not have the latest information about a consumer’s account, the consumer suffers
the consequences. CFPB’s rules require common-sense policies and procedures for handling consumer
accounts and preventing runarounds. These rules include:
5
Payments Promptly Credited: Servicers must credit a borrower’s account the date the payment is
received. Specifically:
• If the servicer receives a payment covering principal, interest, and any required escrow amount, the
payment must be credited the date received, even if the payment does not cover any outstanding
fees;
• If the servicer places partial payments in a “suspense account,” once the amount in such an account
equals a full payment, the servicer must credit it to the borrower’s account.
Prompt Response to Requests for Balances: Servicers must generally provide a response to consumer
requests for the balance of their mortgage loans within seven business days of receiving a written
request.
Errors Corrected and Information Provided Quickly: Servicers must acknowledge and respond to
written notices from consumers with respect to certain errors or requesting information regarding their
mortgage loan accounts. Specifically:
• Servicers must respond to notification of errors or information requests submitted in writing;
• Servicers must generally acknowledge the notification of an error or a request for information
within five days; and
• Generally, within 30-45 days of receiving a notice of error or information request, servicers must:
o Correct the error and notify the borrower of the correction or provide the information
requested;
o Conduct an investigation and notify the borrower that no error has occurred; or
o Notify the borrower that the information requested is not available.
• Many errors fall under the error resolution requirements, including:
o Incorrect calculations of credits or payments;
o Incorrect payments (or non-payments) of taxes and insurance from escrow accounts;
o Inaccurate information about how a borrower can avoid foreclosure; and
o Any other error relating to the servicing of the borrower’s mortgage loan

This merger has not gone well for me at all. Being in banking myself (I worked for National Penn before the merger with KNBT) I know mergers don't always go as expected. I was giving the bank time to straighten out my issue, but what I was told today may be the last straw. I refinanced my mortgage with National Penn back in 2008. My payments were set to auto draft from my checking account every other Friday  (my paydays). The first payment after conversion pulled on Thursday instead of Friday causing an overdraft. I was able to get that fee refunded and was told they would correct the auto draft date. Wrong....next payment came out on Thursday. I called my branch this time and not the customer service number. She had my fee reversed and asked the mortgage dept to correct the auto draft day, showing them how it has always come out on Friday in the past. Mortgage comes back saying they cannot delay pulling the payment until Friday because it is actually due Thursday. Next option is to stop my auto draft so the branch requested them to do this. She called me today saying the Mortgage dept told her they can't stop the auto draft because it is in my documents saying I have to have autopay. WTF!!! I came home from work and looked at my copy of the documents. It says I can cancel my auto draft at anytime!!!! I will be talking to my branch again tomorrow and if this is not resolved, I will be closing my deposit accounts. I do have to say, the lady I am dealing with at the branch is being very helpful and understanding. Kudos to Christina at the Wyomissing, PA branch.

So many close answers! Memorial Day was founded in May 1868 by Gen. John A. Logan. Logan was the commander-in-chief of the Union veterans’ group known as the Grand Army of the Republic. He issued a decree that May 30 become a national commemoration for the more than 620,000 soldiers killed in the Civil War. After World War I, Memorial Day was expanded to honor those who have died in American wars.  In 1971, Memorial Day was declared a national holiday by an act of Congress, though it is still often called Decoration Day.
May 5 by 1868th
May the 5th,1868

Traditional observance
On Memorial Day, the flag of the United States is raised briskly to the top of the staff and then solemnly lowered to the half-staff position, where it remains only until noon. It is then raised to full-staff for the remainder of the day.
The half-staff position remembers the more than one million men and women who gave their lives in service of their country. At noon, their memory is raised by the living, who resolve not to let their sacrifice be in vain, but to rise up in their stead and continue the fight for liberty and justice for all.

Lyndon johnson declared it a national holiday on the last Monday of the month of may.

Why did you remove the bill pay calendar  option from the new app?  With the OLD app, when you went to pick a date to send the payment, a calendar would appear. When you clicked on a date it would show you when the payment would arrive to the payment receiver. With the NEW app, this feature isn't available. Instead, you have to review your payment to see if it will be paid in two or five days. Then you have to cancel the payment, find a calendar, do the simple math, start the bill pay all over again and choose the preferred date.  It is very unfriendly. Because of this reason. I will be deleting this app and simply use a browser to log on BB&T to pay my bills since the calendar option is still available on your website. Even though I like the new app, this feature is very important. I've email BB&T four times about this. The first three emails were replied to saying the calendar option was there.  Finally, the fourth reply confirmed it wasn't, however they didn't know who to contact to have this feature added back. Any suggestions other than contacting the standard 888-228-6654 which is pointless and contact someone that really cares ?

I inherited BBT , I was a former Susquehanna bank customer. BBT took over from them about 6 months ago. They are without a doubt THE WORST BANK EVER! Fees fees and more fees and TERRIBLE customer service.

Very displeased and upset with BB&T banking after 7+ years of being a customer. This bank has stolen $1,380 from me and will not credit my account back (I have never called in to report a problem in the years before this incident). 

Beware of depositing cash in their ATM machines! I deposited $1,380 in 100s and 20s (dollar bills) on a Sunday evening (February 14th). The machine subsequently took the cash and then displayed an error message and gave me no receipt or acknowledgement of the deposit. No deposit activity was shown on the online banking either in the following days. The funds had just vanished. 

I reported the matter to the bank that same evening. 3 days later, a LaKeisha Brown finally got back to me and said an investigation would be opened and gave me a reference number (918969). She stated the matter could take up to 10 business days to resolve.

After 10 business days had passed (15 days altogether) and still hearing from nobody, I called back (today) only to be told that the bank was very busy with a merger and that they were still working on the case. I asked for an updated deadline but the customer service agent refused to provide one stating that “her boss told her she could no longer provide customers with anymore timeframe deadlines but that they were still working on it.”  

While I was still on the phone with this agent, I received a voicemail from LaKeisha Brown (from the same department) asking to call her back. Upon calling Ms. Brown back, she stated that the ATM in question had now been checked for the money and that nothing was found, and that the case would now be closed and that there was nothing else she could do to help.

Very odd how one minute a representative says the case is still being worked on and could take an indefinite amount of time to conclude and then a second later someone else calls and says they have the information they need and case closed.

I then followed up in person at the local BB&T branch where the deposit error occurred (8416 Arlington Blvd Fairfax, VA) and spoke to a manager there named Victor. I relayed to him all the information of everything that had happened. 

He was very puzzled after hearing everything and said he was not aware of anything that had happened at that branch until today (17 days after the incident). He also stated that he was unaware of anyone that had come by to check the ATM for the deposit error. Victor then said he would see what he could do to follow up with managers in the following days to see if anything else could be done.

If I do not get my $1380 returned to me by the end of this month (March) I will withdraw my remaining funds and close down the account. 

I understand banks have to protect themselves against fraudulent deposit claims---but in my case—this is ridiculous! I have been a customer for over 7 years and have never once troubled BB&T before over a deposit dispute claim. 

Why would I wait 7+ years and then all of sudden make up some false deposit claim????

Unbelievable!!! 

I WOULD ADVISE ALL BB&T CUSTOMERS TO VIDEO RECORD THEIR CASH DEPOSITS AT ATMS TO AVOID GETTING SCREWED OVER LIKE I DID!

I never rant on Facebook, but my voice needs to be heard since BB&T will not fix an issue they created. Do not trust your banking to BB&T.  My mother and I went into our local branch and she requested that I be the beneficiary of her account.  I am the only child and my mother was not married.  Unfortunately, my mother was killed in a car accident in November and I'm trying to handle her affairs. Well, went into the branch with her death certificate and guess what, the banker that helped us "forgot a step."  Therefore, it is invalid.  So you mean to tell me that they can forget a step (payable on death was opened with no contact info for me) and not have to rectify the situation? Well, the banker I spoke to the other day told me, they are all "human." Just got disconnected with a consultant that stated in their research "they" " cannot recall that part of the conversation."  Of course that banker is not going to admit they messed up on something so sensitive and legal. So I asked,  but you can see they opened the payable on death account.  Don't you think that would have the person's contact information keyed in.  Heather's response was that "maybe she was going to do that later."  You must be kidding me?  How does a bank get away with this?  My mom and I walked out of that door entrusting that BB&T handled their end.  My mother was young and didn't expect to leave here so soon.  BB&T has made this grieving process even the more difficult!

I'm going to say it like it is.. I dealt with 3 Susquehanna Banks in my area, When I walked in the door someone always said, Hi Paul, or Good afternoon Paul. The point is they knew my name, not because I have alot of money but because I'm a person and not a number. These people knew me and my family and really cared about me. When a person trusts a bank with their money it's a big thing. At least it is to me. Now when I walk into a BB&T bank they yell out Welcome to BB&T... Where's the nicety to that? I do alot of internet banking as well. The Susquehanna Banks web site was the best. If I wanted to pay on my line of credit and just pay on the principal, it would let me do that, and it would up date immediately. But on this BB&T internet banking, I can't pay just on my line, my money goes right to the interest, and it takes up to 12 hours to update. When I was younger, I had 2 accounts at Leesport Bank, a personal account and a business account, I can still remember my banker saying to me, Paul, you don't work for your bank, Your bank works for you... If it wasn't for you the customer, I would be out of a job. It's to bad BB&T doesn't think that way. To be honest, I'm shopping for another bank. I'm looking for a "small business" Bank. Someone that would want to treat me for me, and not for what I have.

BB&T Complaint id#: 2015-21979. 
1-888-628-3926. CEO. Carolyn Connors. 
ceoline@bbandt.co

Today's ordeal was a first for me and my granddaughter. It started when we arrived at BB&T location off El Dorado & Lake Forest. 

My granddaughter and I are members. I left work early so we could go to the bank to get a cashier's check to pay for her 1st car.

Upon arrival we found the bank closed at 5:00 PM as well the drive-thru. As we were driving around the building we saw the bank manager & a teller walking on the sidewalk. I asked if they could help me with my dilemma, at that time I explained to them we need to get a cashier's so we could to go to the dealer tonight with and make the final payment on her car. The bank manager explained there was nothing they could do & told us to call the 1-800 number for assistance. Duly noted, at that point I drove my truck to the front of the bank and preceded to call 1-800 number as instructed. 

As we were sitting in the parking lot we noticed the manager & teller was sitting in their vehicles watching us. They yelled out the car telling us to get off the bank's parking lot. We were not doing anything wrong so I ignored what they were saying. Shortly afterwards the Manager yelled if you don't leave the parking lot now she would call the police. I didn't understand what we're doing to make them want to call the police. I was shocked she threatening us for sitting in the parking lot doing what she suggested calling customer service. About 15 mins later. the Manager drove her truck and parked behind my vehicle yelling you need to leave this parking lot and I called police and they are on their way.  At that point I told her I am talking to a BB&T customer service agent. She drove her car back to her parking space and they sit there waiting on the police.  As they were waiting they were pointing at us & waving their hands.  I don't I ignored them.

I told the customer service agent what they were doing and she apologized for their actions. She offered to file a complaint on my behalf.  I told her It seems to us  are being racially profiled, harassed & threatened. Mind you we never exited our vehicle and posed no threat to them at anytime.

The McKinney Police Officer showed up, my blood pressure went up, I was afraid and nervous as to why she called the police. He got out his car and I explained to the Officer what we were doing & asked him what did they tell 911, he told 911 there was a disturbance happening in the parking lot. 

There were 3 reasons  why I was parked 1). I knew the call would take several minutes to get it resolved and it is was not safe to handle it while driving and 2). I have no a/c in my truck and to stay cool I parked my truck under the tree and 3). I didn't want to lose my cell phone signal.

I am 61 years old, a retiree from PepsiCo, a professional and was with my 19 year granddaughter. The only  reason why we suffered this embarrassing ordeal is because we were Black. We were in the broad open, not hiding or acting suspicious.

For the first time my granddaughter was subjected to racial profiling & the embarrassment of having someone make a frivolous accusation and get the police involved for no reason. It changed her perception about how evil and mean spirited people can all because of the color of our skin.

We were able to resolve the issue with the card, it took 37 minutes. The policeman was very polite, he came over to the truck asked what is happening. I told him the entire story,  he smiled and walked over to the 2 ladies & told them to leave the premise immediately. The Officer left and We stayed in front of the bank and proceeded to finish the transaction and filed a complaint.

If you ever you want to give your employees a gift please make sure they take diversity/sensitivity training. This could have turned into a nightmare. I thank God it didn't.

I will be seeking counsel on this issue. Racial profiling is dangerous and very wrong. It leaves massive damage in our communities. We thank God for sending a sensible Officer to your parking lot. 

Please call me at 214-457-8471 with questions/remarks/concerns.

Regards,

Joyce W. Johnson

Sent from my iPhone

We ask that you please continue to use your current BB&T card until you receive your new chip card from BB&T. Thanks, Erica

I went your Spring Lake NC location, with a check in hand from my lawyer drawn from his BB&T account. The check was for $130,870.25. I talked to the manager and told her over the phone, that I wanted to open a savings account and deposit 130K, but I wanted the 870.25 in cash. The Mgr at first tried to give me a run around and said I would have to deposit all of it, and there would be a 2 week hold to verify the funds. I reminded her that this is 2015, not 1915, and a 2 minute phone call, or 30 seconds on her computer was all she needed. I dont want the bank to have free use of my money for 2 weeks. She put me on hold for a good while, and came back on and told me to come on in, that would be fine. When my wife and I arrived, the manager was out to lunch, and a 20 something girl named Jessica said she would help us. Once we got to her office, I inquired about depositing the money into 2 seperate accounts because FDIC only guarentees 100K. She told me Ishe couldnt split it up like that, and I could not access the money for 2 weeks. She refused to answer any of my questions, and told me my behavior was raising red flags. I asked, "What behavior"? I'm just asking a question. I asked for the customer service number and she said, We dont have one. I asked where the main branch was, and she said, We dont have one. I asked for the phone number to the CEO of BB&T, and she said, I dont have that number.  Why wont you answer my question?, I asked.  She just kept saying, " I'm not going to argue with you, I'll just tell you to have a nice day". I replied, I'm not argueing with you, I just asked you a question. She said again, " I'm not going to argue with you, Have a nice day". We got up and started to leave, and as our backs were turned, she said in a nasty, sarcastic tone, " Have a nice day". In the parking lot, my wife turned to me and asked, "Did we just get thrown out of that bank"? YUP !!! pretty much. Your bank truly sucks. I went to my bank, Bank of America, and deosited the check, got credit for 200 bucks, 4800 tomorrow, and the other 125K next tuesday. I had considred closing my accounts at BOA, and the Credit union and moving to BB&T. But NO WAY IN HELL would I ever bank with you people. We have NEVER been treated so badly, and your smarmy little employee Jessica, just lost you a half a million dollar customer. Piss on you.

I remember when life presented me with a change I wasn't ready for when BB&T bought all the Texas Citibank accounts and I discovered my banking had been transported back in time. Tellers had to hand punch receipts on mechanical devices, my online bill-pay was really just automated check sending (meaning I could no longer pay bills on same day as due) and I had to go into a branch to get my accounts relinked behind my online login (during which time they had to print a form, fill it out, and fax it off and it took 2 weeks to get done). That's why I switched to Ally bank. Because I don't shy away from challenges, even when they surprise me.

43 years ago we did not have things in place for young widows. i was married for 8 months and pregnant when my husband died. i had to move back home to my fathers, wait for my child to be born and then try to start a new life.  it was hard. i worked, went home, cared for my child every evening and fell into bed exausted every night after she went to sleep.  i was very lonely. maybe its better now in 2015 when these things happen. all i know is i look back at  time and shutter. i will be celebrating my 66th birthday tomorrow and although i am not distitute any longer, i lost my second husband of 23 years in 1998 and a boyfriend of 10 years in 2011.  we never know what cards will be dealt to us.

It won't help. Your fraud department is a joke. Several years ago, your fraud area blocked a transaction while were vacationing in NYC because it seemed suspicious. Fast forward to this past Saturday, someone was able to use our debit card number to buy a $1400.00 plane ticket to Ethiopa from San Jose, CA. Now keep in mind was wife was making purchases in Richmond, VA, the same time this was being approved. Fraud didn't block this. I thought customers paid banks to keep our money safe.  As soon as my wife saw it she called your fraud department. She went to one of your branches today because fraud was no help. Now we are just trying to figure out who is more clueless, your fraud department or your branches. Wells Fargo or Bank of America would have been able to reinstate these funds within a couple of hours while the fraud department worked on the case. Neither your fraud department or branch knew what a provisional credit, fraud affidavit, or debit block was. As soon as this gets cleared up, we are leaving this dinosaur of a bank.
